Agent replied: 'Godmorgen HansSå er setuppet på Kasper også klar til din godkendelse.De gamle attachments er bevaret.Der er lidt IPR i UK fronten, men det er ikke sikkert du skal lave det. Du skal først tjekke kontaktpunkterne. Det kan være det kun er noget af IPR der skal laves hvis kontakt punkterne rund om tænderne er blevet for stramme.Der er tilføjet C-chain skinner, der er de sidste tre skinner der kun skal bruges hvis de approximal kontakter i fronten er forløs efter sidste skinne er brugt. Så kan man tage en skinne og lade patienten bruge den i 1-2 uger og så tjekke kontakt punkterne igen. Hvis de stadig er lidt løse så går man videre til næste skinne. Er kontakterne der i mode fine, så skal man ikke bruge den næste skinne.Husk at instruer patienten i at tygge skinnerne rigtigt godt ned over attachments og tænder, brug gerne bagenden af tandbørsten eller chewies, samt at bruge skinnerne 22 timer i døgnet, for at minimerer risikoen for tracking issues.​​For at hjælpe intrusioner på vej anbefaler jeg at tygge på skinnerne 3 gange om dagen i 5 min.Sig endelig til hvis du har nogle spørgsmål.Book releaseMastering Aligner Orthodontics: A Guide for General DentistsCan be ordered at:Mastering Aligner Orthodontics | AlignerService.comOr buy directly on Amazonhttps://a.co/d/4pXzb1SKind regards / Venlig hilsen / Mit freundlichen Grüßen Helle Hatt DDSHelle@alignerservice.comAlignerservice.com-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------DisclaimerAlignerService consists of dentists and orthodontists with extensive clear aligner experience giving clinical advice to practising dentists and their teams. Based on information achieved through the doctor portal of the doctor's preferred clear aligner system (Invisalign, ClearCorrect, SureSmile, Spark), AlignerService offers tentative orthodontic diagnostics, orthodontic treatment planning, optimization of digital treatment plans, and treatment support. AlignerService never has physical contact with the patients or the doctor. As a consequence, neither AlignerService nor its employees can take any responsibility for the treatment outcomes. Any clear aligner software represents planned tooth movements based on a digital setup and does not reflect actual tooth movements; tooth movement data should be used as a reference only. Agent replied: 'Godmorgen SteinaSå er setuppet på #1498892 klar til din godkendelse.De gamle engagers er bevare på nær 3-, som fornyes.Der er stadig en del rotation på den, men også på -3 og 2+2, så husk at holde øje med dem.Husk at instruer patienten i at tygge skinnerne rigtigt godt ned over engagers og tænder, brug gerne bagenden af tandbørsten eller chewies, samt at bruge skinnerne 22 timer i døgnet, for at minimerer risikoen for tracking issues.​​For at hjælpe intrusioner på vej anbefaler jeg at tygge på skinnerne 3 gange om dagen i 5 min.Sig endelig til hvis du har nogle spørgsmål.Book releaseMastering Aligner Orthodontics: A Guide for General DentistsCan be ordered at:Mastering Aligner Orthodontics | AlignerService.comOr buy directly on Amazonhttps://a.co/d/4pXzb1SKind regards / Venlig hilsen / Mit freundlichen Grüßen Helle Hatt DDSHelle@alignerservice.comAlignerservice.com-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------DisclaimerAlignerService consists of dentists and orthodontists with extensive clear aligner experience giving clinical advice to practising dentists and their teams. I will add new ones at the posterior teeth. Allt gott! Vänliga hälsningar, Tandläkare Daniel BarhadoDB Dental LuntmakartandläkarnaLuntmakargatan 81113 51 Stockholm 08-612 09 80www.dbdental.se  Från: Helle Hatt <tps@alignerservice.com> Skickat: den 29 november 2024 06:46Till: Daniel <daniel@dbdental.se>Ämne: Re:[## 10047 ##] 1499043 Set-Up optimize Good morning Daniel The setup on #1499043 is now ready for your approval. There are new engagers on the upper posterior teeth to help with the extrusion to improve the occlusion.I have added c-chain stages at the end if you find that the proximal contacts are too lose after aligner 37 then use nr 38. if still a bit loose after 38 use 39.If there are no issues with the proximal contacts then you should not use the last two aligners. Please remember to instruct the patient to chew the aligners firmly onto their teeth, including the engagers, and to use the aligners for at least 22 hours a day. This will help minimize any tracking issues. The longer the better. If the patient is satisfied with the treatment then you still use the retention protocol. The aligner can be used as a retainer, for a couple of months before changing to an aligner retainer. I recommend full-time wear of the retainer for the first 3-4 months after finishing the treatment. Then 3-4 months with 16-18 hours wear and after that night time wear for the rest of the life. We know that the biology hasn't finished the bone remodelling before 6-8 months after the last tooth movement. One set that the patient is using and one that the patient tests once a month. I recommend full-time wear of the retainer for the first 3-4 months after finishing the treatment. Then 3-4 months with 16-18 hours wear and after that night time wear for the rest of the life. We know that the biology hasn't finished the bone remodelling before 6-8 months after the last tooth movement. That is why it is really important to have retainers as much as possible in the beginning to prevent relapses.   I recommend handing out two sets. One set that the patient is using and one that the patient tests once a month. If the test set starts to feel more tight then it is time to change to a new set. If you see air between the teeth more than 1 mm, then you can try to cut these teeth out of the aligner, and the patient can wear a segmented aligner for 4-6 weeks. Then do a new scan for retainers. I hope this helps. Book releaseMastering Aligner Orthodontics: A Guide for General Dentists Can be ordered at:Mastering Aligner Orthodontics | AlignerService.comOr buy directly on Amazonhttps://a.co/d/4pXzb1S Kind regards / Venlig hilsen / Mit freundlichen Grüßen Helle Hatt DDS Helle@alignerservice.comAlignerservice.com  -----------------------------------------------------------------------------------Disclaimer AlignerService consists of dentists and orthodontists with extensive clear aligner experience giving clinical advice to practising dentists and their teams. I recommend full-time wear of the retainer for the first 3-4 months after finishing the treatment. Then 3-4 months with 16-18 hours wear and after that night time wear for the rest of the life. We know that the biology hasn't finished the bone remodelling before 6-8 months after the last tooth movement. That is why it is really important to have retainers as much as possible in the beginning to prevent relapses.   I recommend handing out two sets. One set that the patient is using and one that the patient tests once a month. If the test set starts to feel more tight then it is time to change to a new set. What is important to check is if you and the patient are satisfied with the aesthetic appearance and the functional occlusion (however that can need settling hens the first 3 months retainer with the aligner or a retainer from the last setup stage and not a scan). I hope this helps. Kind regards / Venlig hilsen / Mit freundlichen Grüßen Helle Hatt DDS Helle@alignerservice.comAlignerservice.com  -----------------------------------------------------------------------------------Disclaimer AlignerService consists of dentists and orthodontists with extensive clear aligner experience giving clinical advice to practising dentists and their teams. The longer the better. If the patient is satisfied with the treatment then you still use the retention protocol. The aligner can be used as a retainer, for a couple of months before changing to an aligner retainer. I recommend full-time wear of the retainer for the first 3-4 months after finishing the treatment. Then 3-4 months with 16-18 hours wear and after that night time wear for the rest of the life. We know that the biology hasn't finished the bone remodelling before 6-8 months after the last tooth movement. That is why it is really important to have retainers as much as possible in the beginning to prevent relapses.   I recommend handing out two sets. One set that the patient is using and one that the patient tests once a month. If the test set starts to feel more tight then it is time to change to a new set. I hope this helps. Book releaseMastering Aligner Orthodontics: A Guide for General DentistsMeet Helle & Jesper Hatt at Swedental at Dentatus on November 13 - 15Get the opportunity to buy a signed copy. Mastering Aligner Orthodontics | AlignerService.comOr buy directly on Amazonhttps://a.co/d/4pXzb1S Kind regards / Venlig hilsen / Mit freundlichen Grüßen Helle Hatt DDS Helle@alignerservice.comAlignerservice.com  -----------------------------------------------------------------------------------Disclaimer AlignerService consists of dentists and orthodontists with extensive clear aligner experience giving clinical advice to practising dentists and their teams. Use the back en of a toothbrush for help. My recommended wearing schedule.In the beginning the aligners should be worn for two weeks. We need to get the biology, the bone remodelling started and that takes 3-4 weeks, and we do not want to be to far a head in the treatment at that point and risk tracking issues already.After a couple of month evaluate to se if everything is tracking and also that the patient has the feeling that the aligners are getting loose after 7-10 day. you can now change the wear time to 7 days.I have attache a guide with tips and tricks to start a ClearCorrect treatment. Please let me know if you have any questions. Our new mail address for collaborator search is: TPS@AlignerService.com Collaborator name is AlignerService Global TPS  Kind regards / Venlig hilsen / Mit freundlichen Grüßen Helle Hatt DDS Helle@alignerservice.comAlignerservice.com  -----------------------------------------------------------------------------------Disclamer AlignerService consists of dentists and orthodontists with extensive clear aligner experience giving clinical advice to practicing dentists and their teams. subject: #1583848 Søren Nørgaardby
content:
Customer asked: 'Kære Helle,


En revision på Søren 


-2 distal rotation
-3 mesial rotation 


Evt. intrusion på 2+, hvis realistisk, mere facial. Hvis det giver mening? Synes når man ligger oppe fra at den “gemmer” sig lidt 


Okklusionen er god posteriort. 




Lejla Kapetanovic

Agent replied: 'Godmorgen HansSå er setuppet på Kasper også klar til din godkendelse.De gamle attachments er bevaret.Der er lidt IPR i UK fronten, men det er ikke sikkert du skal lave det. Du skal først tjekke kontaktpunkterne. Det kan være det kun er noget af IPR der skal laves hvis kontakt punkterne rund om tænderne er blevet for stramme.Der er tilføjet C-chain skinner, der er de sidste tre skinner der kun skal bruges hvis de approximal kontakter i fronten er forløs efter sidste skinne er brugt. Så kan man tage en skinne og lade patienten bruge den i 1-2 uger og så tjekke kontakt punkterne igen. Hvis de stadig er lidt løse så går man videre til næste skinne. Er kontakterne der i mode fine, så skal man ikke bruge den næste skinne.Husk at instruer patienten i at tygge skinnerne rigtigt godt ned over attachments og tænder, brug gerne bagenden af tandbørsten eller chewies, samt at bruge skinnerne 22 timer i døgnet, for at minimerer risikoen for tracking issues.​​For at hjælpe intrusioner på vej anbefaler jeg at tygge på skinnerne 3 gange om dagen i 5 min.Sig endelig til hvis du har nogle spørgsmål.Book releaseMastering Aligner Orthodontics: A Guide for General DentistsCan be ordered at:Mastering Aligner Orthodontics | AlignerService.comOr buy directly on Amazonhttps://a.co/d/4pXzb1SKind regards / Venlig hilsen / Mit freundlichen Grüßen Helle Hatt DDSHelle@alignerservice.comAlignerservice.com-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------DisclaimerAlignerService consists of dentists and orthodontists with extensive clear aligner experience giving clinical advice to practising dentists and their teams. subject: 1499043 Set-Up optimize
content:

She only have occlusal contacts on 44,34,35 - can we make more contacts? What do you recommend? Vänliga hälsningar, Tandläkare Daniel BarhadoDB Dental LuntmakartandläkarnaLuntmakargatan 81113 51 Stockholm 08-612 09 80www.dbdental.se <1732791622343008_2075899757.png> Från: Helle Hatt <tps@alignerservice.com> Skickat: den 15 november 2024 09:09Till: Daniel <daniel@dbdental.se>Ämne: Re:[## 10047 ##] 1499043 Set-Up optimize Hej Daniel Thank you for your questions. If the treatment has been fairly long the use 4 months. The longer the better. If the patient is satisfied with the treatment then you still use the retention protocol. The aligner can be used as a retainer, for a couple of months before changing to an aligner retainer. I recommend full-time wear of the retainer for the first 3-4 months after finishing the treatment. Then 3-4 months with 16-18 hours wear and after that night time wear for the rest of the life. We know that the biology hasn't finished the bone remodelling before 6-8 months after the last tooth movement. That is why it is really important to have retainers as much as possible in the beginning to prevent relapses.   I recommend handing out two sets. One set that the patient is using and one that the patient tests once a month. If the test set starts to feel more tight then it is time to change to a new set. I hope this helps. Book releaseMastering Aligner Orthodontics: A Guide for General DentistsMeet Helle & Jesper Hatt at Swedental at Dentatus on November 13 - 15Get the opportunity to buy a signed copy. Mastering Aligner Orthodontics | AlignerService.comOr buy directly on Amazonhttps://a.co/d/4pXzb1S Kind regards / Venlig hilsen / Mit freundlichen Grüßen Helle Hatt DDS Helle@alignerservice.comAlignerservice.com  -----------------------------------------------------------------------------------Disclaimer AlignerService consists of dentists and orthodontists with extensive clear aligner experience giving clinical advice to practising dentists and their teams. I recommend full-time wear of the retainer for the first 3-4 months after finishing the treatment. Then 3-4 months with 16-18 hours wear and after that night time wear for the rest of the life. We know that the biology hasn't finished the bone remodelling before 6-8 months after the last tooth movement. That is why it is really important to have retainers as much as possible in the beginning to prevent relapses.   I recommend handing out two sets. One set that the patient is using and one that the patient tests once a month. If the test set starts to feel more tight then it is time to change to a new set. If you see air between the teeth more than 1 mm, then you can try to cut these teeth out of the aligner, and the patient can wear a segmented aligner for 4-6 weeks. The longer the better. If the patient is satisfied with the treatment then you still use the retention protocol. The aligner can be used as a retainer, for a couple of months before changing to an aligner retainer. I recommend full-time wear of the retainer for the first 3-4 months after finishing the treatment. Then 3-4 months with 16-18 hours wear and after that night time wear for the rest of the life. We know that the biology hasn't finished the bone remodelling before 6-8 months after the last tooth movement. That is why it is really important to have retainers as much as possible in the beginning to prevent relapses.   I recommend handing out two sets. One set that the patient is using and one that the patient tests once a month. Use the back en of a toothbrush for help. My recommended wearing schedule.In the beginning the aligners should be worn for two weeks. We need to get the biology, the bone remodelling started and that takes 3-4 weeks, and we do not want to be to far a head in the treatment at that point and risk tracking issues already.After a couple of month evaluate to se if everything is tracking and also that the patient has the feeling that the aligners are getting loose after 7-10 day. you can now change the wear time to 7 days.I have attache a guide with tips and tricks to start a ClearCorrect treatment. Please let me know if you have any questions. Our new mail address for collaborator search is: TPS@AlignerService.com Collaborator name is AlignerService Global TPS  Kind regards / Venlig hilsen / Mit freundlichen Grüßen Helle Hatt DDS Helle@alignerservice.comAlignerservice.com  -----------------------------------------------------------------------------------Disclamer AlignerService consists of dentists and orthodontists with extensive clear aligner experience giving clinical advice to practicing dentists and their teams. Agent replied: 'Hi DanielI recommend that you wait until the bite has settled a bit more.My retainer protocol is as follows.The aligner can be used as a retainer, for a couple of months before changing to an aligner retainer. I recommend full-time wear of the retainer for the first 3-4 months after finishing the treatment. Then 3-4 months with 16-18 hours wear and after that night time wear for the rest of the life. We know that the biology hasn't finished the bone remodelling before 6-8 months after the last tooth movement. That is why it is really important to have retainers as much as possible in the beginning to prevent relapses.  I recommend handing out two sets. One set that the patient is using and one that the patient tests once a month. If the test set starts to feel more tight then it is time to change to a new set.If you see air between the teeth more than 1 mm, then you can try to cut these teeth out of the aligner, and the patient can wear a segmented aligner for 4-6 weeks. Then do a new scan for retainers.I hope this helps.Book releaseMastering Aligner Orthodontics: A Guide for General DentistsCan be ordered at:Mastering Aligner Orthodontics | AlignerService.comOr buy directly on Amazonhttps://a.co/d/4pXzb1SKind regards / Venlig hilsen / Mit freundlichen Grüßen Helle Hatt DDSHelle@alignerservice.comAlignerservice.com-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------DisclaimerAlignerService consists of dentists and orthodontists with extensive clear aligner experience giving clinical advice to practising dentists and their teams. When do you do bonded retainers? Vänliga hälsningar, Tandläkare Daniel BarhadoDB Dental LuntmakartandläkarnaLuntmakargatan 81113 51 Stockholm 08-612 09 80www.dbdental.se  <1732791622409024_2075899757.png> Från: Helle Hatt <tps@alignerservice.com> Skickat: den 13 september 2024 09:44Till: daniel <daniel@dbdental.se>Ämne: Re:[## 10047 ##] 1499043 Set-Up optimize Dear Daniel My retainer protocol is as follows. The aligner can be used as a retainer, for a couple of months before changing to an aligner retainer. I recommend full-time wear of the retainer for the first 3-4 months after finishing the treatment. Then 3-4 months with 16-18 hours wear and after that night time wear for the rest of the life. We know that the biology hasn't finished the bone remodelling before 6-8 months after the last tooth movement. That is why it is really important to have retainers as much as possible in the beginning to prevent relapses.   I recommend handing out two sets. One set that the patient is using and one that the patient tests once a month. If the test set starts to feel more tight then it is time to change to a new set. What is important to check is if you and the patient are satisfied with the aesthetic appearance and the functional occlusion (however that can need settling hens the first 3 months retainer with the aligner or a retainer from the last setup stage and not a scan). I hope this helps. Kind regards / Venlig hilsen / Mit freundlichen Grüßen Helle Hatt DDS Helle@alignerservice.comAlignerservice.com  -----------------------------------------------------------------------------------Disclaimer AlignerService consists of dentists and orthodontists with extensive clear aligner experience giving clinical advice to practising dentists and their teams. It can be that there is air the first couple of days. That is when it is really important that the patient bites on the aligner. Use the back en of a toothbrush for help. My recommended wearing schedule.In the beginning the aligners should be worn for two weeks. We need to get the biology, the bone remodelling started and that takes 3-4 weeks, and we do not want to be to far a head in the treatment at that point and risk tracking issues already.After a couple of month evaluate to se if everything is tracking and also that the patient has the feeling that the aligners are getting loose after 7-10 day. you can now change the wear time to 7 days.I have attache a guide with tips and tricks to start a ClearCorrect treatment. Please let me know if you have any questions. Our new mail address for collaborator search is: TPS@AlignerService.com Collaborator name is AlignerService Global TPS  Kind regards / Venlig hilsen / Mit freundlichen Grüßen Helle Hatt DDS Helle@alignerservice.comAlignerservice.com  -----------------------------------------------------------------------------------Disclamer AlignerService consists of dentists and orthodontists with extensive clear aligner experience giving clinical advice to practicing dentists and their teams. subject: #1583848 Søren Nørgaardby
content:
Customer asked: 'Kære Helle,


En revision på Søren 


-2 distal rotation
-3 mesial rotation 


Evt. intrusion på 2+, hvis realistisk, mere facial. Hvis det giver mening? Synes når man ligger oppe fra at den “gemmer” sig lidt 


Okklusionen er god posteriort. 




Lejla Kapetanovic
Tandreguleringsteamet

Godt Smil Taastrup & Hørsholm'

subject: Revision af Mariyah Arentsen  #1333567
content:
Customer asked: 'Kære Helle 




Vil du rette følgende case: der mangler forsat let rotation af 2+ og opstramning af samtlige app kontakter. 




Clearcorrect - Brøndby - Case # 1333567

Med venlig hilsen


     Hans Straarup RasmussenTandlægeColosseum Tandlægerne | BrøndbyNygårds Plads 3 B, 2605 BrøndbyTelefon: +45 3675 0133 Hans.Rasmussen@colosseumklinikken.dk Vi passer godt på dine data – læs mere.Vores emails er altid krypterede  – læs mere.'
Agent replied: 'Dear Hans Straarup Rasmussen​Thank you for your message – we appreciate your trust in AlignerService.We’ve received your request, and the team has already begun processing it.If you’re submitting a new case, the dentist typically assigned to you has been notified and will review the case shortly.You'll hear from us as soon as your setup is ready for approval or if we need any further information to proceed.Please note that we handle all cases during normal business hours, and we do our best to ensure timely feedback.Warm regards,The AlignerService Teamtps@alignerservice.comAlignerservice.com'
Agent replied: 'Godmorgen HansSÅ er setuppet på #1333567 klar til din godkendelse.Der er lidt forbedrende rettelsernpå 2,1+ primært.Kontaktpunkterne strammes op.Hvis der er behov for mere har jeg også tilføjet c-chain skinner.Det er de sidste to skinner der kun skal bruges hvis de approximal kontakter i fronten er forløs efter sidste skinne er brugt. Så kan man tage en skinne og lade patienten bruge den i 1-2 uger og så tjekke kontakt punkterne igen. Hvis de stadig er lidt løse så går man videre til næste skinne. Er kontakterne der i mode fine, så skal man ikke bruge den næste skinne.Husk at instruer patienten i at tygge skinnerne rigtigt godt ned over engagers og tænder, brug gerne bagenden af tandbørsten eller chewies, samt at bruge skinnerne 22 timer i døgnet, for at minimerer risikoen for tracking issues.​​For at hjælpe intrusioner på vej anbefaler jeg at tygge på skinnerne 3 gange om dagen i 5 min.Sig endelig til hvis du har nogle spørgsmål.Book releaseMastering Aligner Orthodontics: A Guide for General DentistsCan be ordered at:Mastering Aligner Orthodontics | AlignerService.comOr buy directly on Amazonhttps://a.co/d/4pXzb1SKind regards / Venlig hilsen / Mit freundlichen Grüßen Helle Hatt DDSHelle@alignerservice.comAlignerservice.com-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------DisclaimerAlignerService consists of dentists and orthodontists with extensive clear aligner experience giving clinical advice to practising dentists and their teams. subject: Clearcorrect case #1691774
content:
Customer asked: 'Hi HellePatient is almost happy..  The lower one is very good but there is still a small small "step" between 12 and 11.Patient really wants to push the mesial part of 12 just a little buccal. (rotate)Can you help us make it happen?There is a black triangle between 11 and 21, I am planning to change the fillings mesial in 11 and 21 and close the triangle when I do that. Do you think that will work out?(I will also place an incisal filling in 12.)And after all that, do a new scan and get the retainer aligners.  Have her sleep with them for 6 months and then place metal retainers in the upper and lower.  Does that sound like a decent plan? Can you maybe recommend a metal retainer to order?best regardsArnar'
Customer asked: 'Hi HelleThank you so much for your answer :)On Mon, May 5, 2025 at 12:55 PM Helle Hatt <helle@alignerservice.com> wrote:Dear ArnarThank you for your email.It would be my pleasure to help.It often works with composite to close black triangles.Personally, I prefer braided wires to make the retainer from. The easiest is to order them at a lab where you send in a scan they can make it from.My retainer protocol is as follows The aligner can be used as a retainer, for a couple of months before changing to an aligner retainer. I recommend full-time wear of the retainer for the first 3-4 months after finishing the treatment. Then 3-4 months with 16-18 hours wear, and after that nighttime wear for the rest of your life. We know that the biology hasn't finished the bone remodelling before 6-8 months after the last tooth movement. That is why it is really important to have retainers as much as possible in the beginning to prevent relapses.  I recommend handing out two sets. One set that the patient is using and one that the patient tests once a month. If the test set starts to feel tighter, then it is time to change to a new set.For a bonded retainer, you need to make sure that there hasn't been a lot of posterior movements, otherwise, they will have a risk of relapse.I will let you know when the setup is ready for your approval.Book releaseMastering Aligner Orthodontics: A Guide for General DentistsCan be ordered at:Mastering Aligner Orthodontics | AlignerService.comOr buy directly on Amazonhttps://a.co/d/4pXzb1SKind regards / Venlig hilsen / Mit freundlichen Grüßen Helle Hatt DDSHelle@alignerservice.comAlignerservice.com-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------DisclaimerAlignerService consists of dentists and orthodontists with extensive clear aligner experience giving clinical advice to practising dentists and their teams. Ja jeg beklager, men det har taget meget lang tid for teknikkerne at lave første revision setup. jeg fik det først i gåreftermiddags.

OBS hvis i ændre jeres kliniske preferencer til not remove engagers ved revisioner, så kan det også gå lidt hurtigere. Nogen gange kan teknikkerne ikke finde ud af at bevare engagers samtidig med at de skal følge nye rettelser, og så tager det en ekstra
 gang frem og tilbage.

subject: Fallplanung Clearcorrect #1703839
content:
Customer asked: 'Sehr geehrte Frau Doktor, wir haben diesen Fall letztes Jahr im März/April geplant und der Patient ist nun mit den Schienen fertig. Er möchte gerne noch ein paar Verbesserungen vornehmen: die Unterkieferfront möchte er weiter ausrotiert haben, man sieht im neuen Scan, dass der Zahn 41, 32 und 33 noch etwas mehr Rotation und Translation benötigen, um sie harmonischer in den Zahnbogen zu stellen. Mir ist noch eingefallen, ob man durch ein wenig mehr Intrusion der unteren Front den Overbite verbessern könnte, da wir am Ende Retainerdrähte in OK und UK kleben möchten.Im Oberkiefer stört die Position des Zahns 12 den Patienten – ich habe ihn aufgeklärt, dass er anatomisch anders geformt ist als der Zahn 22 und wir den Zahn 12 ein wenig nach mesial rotieren können, um dann mit Composite den Zahn an der mesialen Fläche zu verbreitern, um das black triangle zwischen 11 und 12 zu schließen.Bitte werfen Sie einen Blick auf das Setup in Clearcorrect und ändern Sie es, falls notwendig – vielen Dank! Viele Grüße,Amar Besic   Ordination Dr. Amar BesicWulfeniaplatz 1/79620 HermagorTel: 04282 / 25 955www.besic.atordination@besic.at Unsere ÖffnungszeitenMontag & Dienstag: 08:30 – 16:00 UhrMittwoch & Donnerstag: 08:30 – 14:00 UhrFreitag: 08:30 – 11:30 Uhr Von: Helle Hatt (Hatt Consulting GmbH via bexio.com) <noreply@bexio.com> Gesendet: Donnerstag, 4. April 2024 15:53An: ordination@besic.atBetreff: Rechnung von Hatt Consulting, Aligner Service Sehr geehrte(r) Ordination Dr. Amar Besic Wir danken für Ihren Auftrag und berechnen unsere Leistungen wie folgt: Datum: 04.04.2024 Betrag: EUR 398.00 Zahlbar bis: 13.04.2024 Unter folgendem Link können Sie die Rechnung ansehen und bezahlen: RE-02420 Wir bitten um Bezahlung über einer der zur Verfügung stehenden Zahlungsmöglichkeit. Für Rückfragen zu dieser Rechnung stehen wir jederzeit gerne zur Verfügung. Freundliche Grüsse Hatt Consulting GmbH'
Agent replied: 'Dear Ordination Dr. Amar Besic​Thank you for your message – we appreciate your trust in AlignerService.We’ve received your request, and the team has already begun processing it.If you’re submitting a new case, the dentist typically assigned to you has been notified and will review the case shortly.You'll hear from us as soon as your setup is ready for approval or if we need any further information to proceed.Please note that we handle all cases during normal business hours, and we do our best to ensure timely feedback.Warm regards,The AlignerService Teamtps@alignerservice.comAlignerservice.com'

subject: VB: kontakt med Helle #1663545
content:
Customer asked: 'Hi again Helle!I have a problem with 16 in this case, it hasn´t moved like I wished. Today I realised the cause of the problem:There is a tuberculum carabelli on the palatinal side and the aligner has landed on the top of the tuberculum, not around the tooth. 16 is therefore intruded and slightly tipped palatinalt.I took new silicone imprints,  I guess the best to do is to order new aligners?I have cut the interrupting part of the aligner reg 16 paltinalt and she wears it until new aligners arrive. In my dreams there will be a relapse regarding 16, hopefully.What is your thoughts about this scenario?Case # 1663545Kindly Marie Ranta, leg tandläkare StockholmDen fre 19 apr. 2024 kl 12:00 skrev Helle Hatt <tps@alignerservice.com>:Hej MarieThank you for your question.Looking at the bitoype the risk is not that big, but it looks on the photo that there already is a recession on 16, 14 Difficult to see on the left side.You can decrease the risk by making the movement slower and getting more aligners.I hope this helpsKind regards / Venlig hilsen / Mit freundlichen Grüßen Helle Hatt DDSHelle@alignerservice.comAlignerservice.com-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------DisclaimerAlignerService consists of dentists and orthodontists with extensive clear aligner experience giving clinical advice to practising dentists and their teams. subject: TPS #1755623
content:
Customer asked: 'Hey,I have seen the new set up. The translation of teeth 14 and 15 is also very high and not predictable…Wouldn’t it be better to do less translation? The plan was to solve the problems in the front and now also to close the open bite posterior. So I would like to end with +- the same occlusion as in the beginning. I want to minimize the chance of loss of tracking…Kind regards,Maarten GrootaertOp vr 2 mei 2025 om 14:25 schreef Priyanka  Cherian <tps@alignerservice.com>Dear Maarten,Thank you for your email.Great—I’ll send the setup to the technicians and will be in touch as soon as it’s ready for your approval.It can be difficult to predict exactly how treatment will progress and what the best course of action might be if things don’t go to plan. The best approach is for you to send me progress photographs towards the end of treatment, and we can review the case together to decide on the most suitable next steps.The simplest option is usually to trim the aligners distal to the 3s and allow for natural settling. Occlusion typically stabilizes within 4–6 weeks. However, this depends on the amount of settling required. If more than 1.5 mm of settling is needed, it’s best to add settling elastics in combination with the trimmed aligners.Please let me know if you have any questions.Our new mail address for collaborator search is: helle@alignerservice.comCollaborator name is AlignerService Global TPS  Kind regards,Priyanka Cherian tps@alignerservice.comAlignerservice.comDisclaimer:AlignerService consists of dentists and orthodontists with extensive clear aligner experience, providing clinical advice to practicing dentists and their teams. Tak for det.




Hvad er dine anbefalinger ift. retention på sådan en case her? 




Hvor længe anbefaler du essix skinne og hvad skal jeg være opmærksom på når jeg vurderer, hvor længe de skal bruge essix skinne, før de må få fast retainer på? og skal de forsat sove med essix skinne når de har fået retainer på?










Med venlig hilsen

Korsgade 9 / 9500 Hobro
 



Fra: Helle Hatt <helle@alignerservice.com>
Sendt: 8. maj 2025 06:57
Til: Harald Tandlægerne Hobro <hobro@harald.dk>
Emne: Re: Case #1795887
 



Godmorgen Janni



Så er setuppet på #1795887 klar til din godkendelse.



Der er lidt IPR i OK højre side for at få plads til at rotere tænderne på plads.

De gamle engagers er bevare.







Husk
 at instruer patienten i at tygge skinnerne rigtigt godt ned over engagers og tænder, brug gerne bagenden af tandbørsten eller chewies, samt at bruge skinnerne 22 timer i døgnet, for at minimerer risikoen for tracking issues.​​


For at hjælpe intrusioner på vej anbefaler jeg at tygge på skinnerne 3 gange om dagen i 5 min.






Sig
 endelig til hvis du har nogle spørgsmål.

Customer asked: 'okay, er den generelt for alle cases eller kan en fast retainertråd sættes på hvis det primær kun er fronten, som er reguleret.

Jeg har en lille cases #2052848 vil man i dette tilfælde kunne sætte en retainertråd på tidligere?




Med venlig hilsen
Janni 
 
___
 

 
Harald Tandlægerne Hobro
Korsgade 9 / 9500 Hobro
 



Fra: Helle Hatt <helle@alignerservice.com>
Sendt: 8. maj 2025 09:42
Til: Harald Tandlægerne Hobro <hobro@harald.dk>
Emne: Re: Case #1795887
 



Hej Janni



Dette er min aligner retainer protokol.




Aligneren kan bruges som en retainer i et par måneder, før man skifter til en aligner-retainer. Jeg anbefaler fuldtidsbrug af retaineren de første 3-4 måneder efter endt behandling. Derefter 3-4 måneder med 16-18 timers brug og derefter natbrug resten
 af livet. Vi ved, at biologien ikke er færdig med at genopbygge knoglen før 6-8 måneder efter den sidste tandbevægelse. Det er derfor, det er så vigtigt at have skinner på så meget som muligt i starten for at forhindre tilbagefald.  




Jeg anbefaler, at man udleverer to sæt. Et sæt, som patienten bruger, og et, som patienten tester en gang om måneden. Hvis testsættet begynder at føles mere stramt, er det tid til at skifte til et nyt sæt.



Grunden til at jeg primært btuger aligner retainer er at en bonded retainer kun holder på fronten.

Dvs hvis i kun laver bonded retainer vil de posterior tænder flytte sig over tid.



I kan i princippet sætte bonded retainer på lige efter sides skinner har været brugt 1-2 uger, men jeg vil fortsat bruge aligneren, men så skal den klippes til svarend til den bonded retainer. Jeg føler mig dog mere sikker på at vente med den bonded retainer
 3-4 måneder.



Jeg håber det giver mening.

Agent replied: 'Hej JanniDette er min aligner retainer protokol.Aligneren kan bruges som en retainer i et par måneder, før man skifter til en aligner-retainer. Jeg anbefaler fuldtidsbrug af retaineren de første 3-4 måneder efter endt behandling. Derefter 3-4 måneder med 16-18 timers brug og derefter natbrug resten af livet. Vi ved, at biologien ikke er færdig med at genopbygge knoglen før 6-8 måneder efter den sidste tandbevægelse. Det er derfor, det er så vigtigt at have skinner på så meget som muligt i starten for at forhindre tilbagefald.  Jeg anbefaler, at man udleverer to sæt. Et sæt, som patienten bruger, og et, som patienten tester en gang om måneden. Hvis testsættet begynder at føles mere stramt, er det tid til at skifte til et nyt sæt.Grunden til at jeg primært btuger aligner retainer er at en bonded retainer kun holder på fronten.Dvs hvis i kun laver bonded retainer vil de posterior tænder flytte sig over tid.I kan i princippet sætte bonded retainer på lige efter sides skinner har været brugt 1-2 uger, men jeg vil fortsat bruge aligneren, men så skal den klippes til svarend til den bonded retainer. Jeg føler mig dog mere sikker på at vente med den bonded retainer 3-4 måneder.Jeg håber det giver mening.Book releaseMastering Aligner Orthodontics: A Guide for General DentistsCan be ordered at:Mastering Aligner Orthodontics | AlignerService.comOr buy directly on Amazonhttps://a.co/d/4pXzb1SKind regards / Venlig hilsen / Mit freundlichen Grüßen Helle Hatt DDSHelle@alignerservice.comAlignerservice.com-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------DisclaimerAlignerService consists of dentists and orthodontists with extensive clear aligner experience giving clinical advice to practising dentists and their teams.  at instruer patienten i at tygge skinnerne rigtigt godt ned over engagers og tænder, brug gerne bagenden af tandbørsten eller chewies, samt at bruge skinnerne 22 timer i døgnet, for at minimerer risikoen for tracking issues.​​


For at hjælpe intrusioner på vej anbefaler jeg at tygge på skinnerne 3 gange om dagen i 5 min.

Emne: Re: Case #1795887
 



Hej Janni



Dette er min aligner retainer protokol.




Aligneren kan bruges som en retainer i et par måneder, før man skifter til en aligner-retainer. Jeg anbefaler fuldtidsbrug af retaineren de første 3-4 måneder efter endt behandling. Derefter 3-4 måneder med 16-18 timers brug og derefter natbrug resten
 af livet. Vi ved, at biologien ikke er færdig med at genopbygge knoglen før 6-8 måneder efter den sidste tandbevægelse. Det er derfor, det er så vigtigt at have skinner på så meget som muligt i starten for at forhindre tilbagefald.  




Jeg anbefaler, at man udleverer to sæt. Et sæt, som patienten bruger, og et, som patienten tester en gang om måneden. Hvis testsættet begynder at føles mere stramt, er det tid til at skifte til et nyt sæt.



Grunden til at jeg primært btuger aligner retainer er at en bonded retainer kun holder på fronten.

Dvs hvis i kun laver bonded retainer vil de posterior tænder flytte sig over tid.



I kan i princippet sætte bonded retainer på lige efter sides skinner har været brugt 1-2 uger, men jeg vil fortsat bruge aligneren, men så skal den klippes til svarend til den bonded retainer. Jeg føler mig dog mere sikker på at vente med den bonded retainer
 3-4 måneder.



Jeg håber det giver mening.

Customer asked: 'Hej Helle,

Patienten indrømmer, at hun ikke har været for god til at anvende Chewies'ene her på det seneste - hun går i gang med dette. Vi fortsætter behandlingen som planlagt og håber på mere intrusion. Indtil videre skifter hun skinnerne hver 14. dag.

Fra: Helle Hatt <tps@alignerservice.com>
Sendt: 7. maj 2025 11:28
Til: Ditte Skyum <dis@harald.dk>
Emne: Re: Case #1874642: Laura Vangsgaard Jensen
 



Hej Ditte



Det er meget normalt at biddet ikke er helt som på setuppet.

I din case kan jog godt se en lille forskel. Jeg vil gætte på at du så har lidt hårde kontakter i fronten, som tyder på at intrusionen af UK fronten er lidt bag efter.





Her
 vil jeg anbefale at patienten tygger på skinnerne. Brug chewies eller bagenden af en tandbørste. 3 gange om dagen i 5 minutter for at hjælpe intrusionen på vej.





Det er fint at fortsætte og se tiden an.



Håber det hjælper.

subject: hjälp med case 1895177
content:
Customer asked: 'Hej Helle! I hav esome tracking issues witg 13, 22, and 23. The engagers is removed from 13. New scan and photos is uploaded. Can you please help med with a revision?
 
 

Varma Hälsningar
CHRISTINE KARLSSON
 
Tandvis
Storgatan 24 | 331 37 Värnamo
Telefon: 0370-142 12 | www.tandvis.se
E-post: info@tandvis.se


 


Från: Helle Hatt <tps@alignerservice.com>

Skickat: den 11 november 2024 16:51
Till: Christine.Karlsson <Christine@tandvis.se>
Ämne: Re:[## 19520 ##] hjälp med case 1895177


 






Dear Christien


 


The setup on #1895177 is now ready for your approval.


 


There is a moderate amount of extrusion even if the bite is not closed, but since that is not a must I believe that it will be more predictable not to try to go for it.


There are a lot of rotations on 13,23 I will expect tracking issues on those.


 


Be prepared to do a couple of revisions. Take it slowly then I believe that the end result will be good.


 


There is also some IPR to minimise the protrusion. 


The patient is already a bit protrusive and we do not want to make it worse.


 





Please remember to instruct the patient to chew the aligners firmly onto their teeth, including the engagers, and to use the aligners for at least 22 hours a day. This will help
 minimize any tracking issues. I also recommend that the patient chews on the aligners using the back end of a toothbrush or chewies three times a day for five minutes to assist with intrusion.      


 




Please let me know if you have any questions.

Good morning Christine













 

It is a bit more complex case. It will require a log of IPR in the lower arch. 


If we make intrusion of the molars just 0.5 each arch we can gain a reduction of the open bite for about 3 mm which looks sufficient.


I always try to make the plans without extractions But we need to look out for the risk of recessions and keep a positive overjet.


 


If you are up for doing this more complex case I will be happy to help you with the setup and guide you through the treatment.


 


Just let me know if you want me to continue with the setup.


 


I wish you a nice day.

Ämne: Re:[## 19520 ##] hjälp med case 1895177


 






Dear Christien


 


The setup on #1895177 is now ready for your approval.


 


There is a moderate amount of extrusion even if the bite is not closed, but since that is not a must I believe that it will be more predictable not to try to go for it.


There are a lot of rotations on 13,23 I will expect tracking issues on those.


 


Be prepared to do a couple of revisions. Take it slowly then I believe that the end result will be good.


 


There is also some IPR to minimise the protrusion. 


The patient is already a bit protrusive and we do not want to make it worse.


 





Please remember to instruct the patient to chew the aligners firmly onto their teeth, including the engagers, and to use the aligners for at least 22 hours a day. This will help
 minimize any tracking issues. I also recommend that the patient chews on the aligners using the back end of a toothbrush or chewies three times a day for five minutes to assist with intrusion.      


 




Please let me know if you have any questions.

Ämne: Re:[## 19520 ##] hjälp med case 1895177


 






Dear Christien


 


The setup on #1895177 is now ready for your approval.


 


There is a moderate amount of extrusion even if the bite is not closed, but since that is not a must I believe that it will be more predictable not to try to go for it.


There are a lot of rotations on 13,23 I will expect tracking issues on those.


 


Be prepared to do a couple of revisions. Take it slowly then I believe that the end result will be good.


 


There is also some IPR to minimise the protrusion. 


The patient is already a bit protrusive and we do not want to make it worse.


 





Please remember to instruct the patient to chew the aligners firmly onto their teeth, including the engagers, and to use the aligners for at least 22 hours a day. This will help
 minimize any tracking issues. I also recommend that the patient chews on the aligners using the back end of a toothbrush or chewies three times a day for five minutes to assist with intrusion.      


 




Please let me know if you have any questions.

Good morning Christine













 

It is a bit more complex case. It will require a log of IPR in the lower arch. 


If we make intrusion of the molars just 0.5 each arch we can gain a reduction of the open bite for about 3 mm which looks sufficient.


I always try to make the plans without extractions But we need to look out for the risk of recessions and keep a positive overjet.


 


If you are up for doing this more complex case I will be happy to help you with the setup and guide you through the treatment.


 


Just let me know if you want me to continue with the setup.


 


I wish you a nice day.

Ämne: Re:[## 23725 ##] Treatment planning 2040858
 




Good morning Josefin



The setup on #2040858 is now ready for your approval.



You do not have to extract 18,28 for the alignment, but it can be a bit difficult to get the aligners on the teeth.



There is IPR in the upper arch to make sure that she is not becoming too protrusive.



There are some big rotations (teeth with vertical engagers) you need to keep an eye on. Make sure that the aligners are seated correctly on the engagers to minimise the risk of tracking issues.



I have attached a guide with tips and tricks to help you work with aligners.






Please remember to instruct the patient to chew the aligners firmly onto their teeth, including the engagers, and to wear them for at least 22 hours a day. This will help minimize any tracking issues. I also recommend that the patient chews on the aligners
 using the back end of a toothbrush or chewies three times a day for five minutes to assist with the intrusion.




Please
 let me know if you have any questions.

Aan: Tandartspraktijk Luk Daneels <luk@tandartsdaneels.be>
Onderwerp: Re: #2071281


 


Dear Luk


 


The setup on #2071281 is now ready for your approval.


 


There is a lot of buccal movement in the lower front. Please look out for the risk of recessions.


 


I think that is as close as we can get to contact in the front. There is contact on 42.


 


Please let me know what you think.


 


Have a nice weekend.

The bit is now set correctly initially, and the movements have been optimised to match it.


 






Please remember to instruct the patient to chew the aligners firmly onto their teeth, including the engagers, and to wear them for at
 least 22 hours a day. This will help minimise any tracking issues. I also recommend that the patient chews on the aligners using the back end of a toothbrush or chewies three times a day for five minutes to assist with the intrusion.

Dear Luk


 


The setup on #2071281 is now ready for your approval.


 


The bit is now set correctly initially, and the movements have been optimised to match it.


 






Please remember to instruct the patient to chew the aligners firmly onto their teeth, including the engagers, and to wear them
 for at least 22 hours a day. This will help minimise any tracking issues. I also recommend that the patient chews on the aligners using the back end of a toothbrush or chewies three times a day for five minutes to assist with the intrusion.


 








Please let me know if you have any questions.

The setup on #2071281 is now ready for your approval.

Since Helle Hatt is on vacation this week, our orthodontist, Yazmina Ortega,
 has reviewed the setup from the technicians. It is now ready for your approval, Yazmina writes this to you:


 


The setup on #2071281 is now ready for your approval.


 


There is IPR in the upper and lower arch.


 


Keep an eye on 3.5 (crown buccal torque) 


 


The upper front was not moved. 


 


There is significant anterior-inferior intrusion, which will help correct the anterior deep bite.


 


Make sure that the engagers are seated correctly in the aligners to minimise tracking issues.


 


Please remember to instruct the patient to chew the aligners firmly onto their teeth, including the engagers, and to use the
 aligners for at least 22 hours a day. 


 


This will help minimize any tracking issues. I also recommend that the patient chews on the aligners using the back end of
 a toothbrush or chewies three times a day for five minutes to assist with intrusion.


 


Please let me know if you have any questions.

The setup on #2071281 is now ready for your approval.


 


There is IPR in the upper and lower arch.


 


Keep an eye on 3.5 (crown buccal torque) 


 


The upper front was not moved.

subject: Plan #2064744, #2067428
content:
Customer asked: 'Liebe Frau Dr Hatt,


Bitte bei dem Patienten #2064744 bitte den Plan nochmals anschauen, Patient hat nach dem plan noch einen Overjet und im 1 Quadranten passt die Klasse nicht.


Vielen Dank 
Liebe Grüße 
Ordination 
Dr. Nikolaus Fuchs


Gesendet von 
Outlook für iOS

Von: Helle Hatt <tps@alignerservice.com>
Gesendet: Friday, May 2, 2025 4:01:14 PM
An: Flo@zahnarztfuchs.at <Flo@zahnarztfuchs.at>
Betreff: Re: 2065980
 


















Liebe Flo


das Setup auf #2065980 ist jetzt bereit für deine Genehmigung.


Es gibt eine ASR in der oberen rechten Seite, um sicherzustellen, dass die obere Mittellinie nicht verschoben wird.
Bitte achte auf die Rotationen an 12,22



Bitte denk daran, den Patienten anzuweisen, die Aligner fest auf die Zähne zu kauen, einschließlich der Engager,
 und die Aligner mindestens 22 Stunden pro Tag zu tragen. Dies wird dazu beitragen, Probleme mit dem Tracking zu minimieren. Ich empfehle außerdem, dass der Patient dreimal täglich fünf Minuten lang mit dem hinteren Ende einer Zahnbürste auf den Alignern kaut,
 um das Eindringen zu erleichtern.


Bitte lass mich wissen, wenn du irgendwelche Fragen hast. 














Ich wünsche dir einen schönen Tag.

Agent replied: 'Liebe Flovielen Dank für deine Mail.Es ist absolut richtig.Ich werde nicht empfehlen, den 16. Sie hat zunächst eine gute Okklusion und eine Gingivarezession, die noch schlimmer wird, wenn wir versuchen zu distalisieren.Der Biss in Q1 sieht in einer vollen KL II sehr stabil aus, was auch gegen eine Korrektur spricht. Es wird zu einer instabilen Okklusion führen, weil wir nicht in der Lage sein werden, eine volle KL I zu erreichen. es wird die obere Mittellinie verschieben und einen Kreuzbiss in der Front erzeugen.Ich empfehle nicht, die Zähne zu stark zurückzuziehen, nur um die Lücken zu schließen. Das würde den Platz für die Zunge beeinträchtigen und zu Schlafapnoe führen.In diesem Fall empfehle ich, im Unterkiefer etwas Platz zu lassen, um den Überbiss zu verkleinern, und dann die Zähne zu restaurieren sowie die obere Front zu sanieren.Ich hoffe, das macht Sinn.Bitte lass mich wissen, wenn du irgendwelche Fragen hast.Book releaseMastering Aligner Orthodontics: A Guide for General DentistsCan be ordered at:Mastering Aligner Orthodontics | AlignerService.comOr buy directly on Amazonhttps://a.co/d/4pXzb1SKind regards / Venlig hilsen / Mit freundlichen Grüßen Helle Hatt DDSHelle@alignerservice.comAlignerservice.com-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------DisclaimerAlignerService consists of dentists and orthodontists with extensive clear aligner experience giving clinical advice to practising dentists and their teams. subject: Vurdering af Alignercase TrioClear #38474
content:
Customer asked: 'Tusind tak Helle.
Jeg får kaldt pt ind til en gennemgang af planen.
Er det sådan at jeg kan bruge dig undervejs, såfremt at der er nogle udfordringer?
Mvh. Karin
 


Fra: Helle Hatt <tps@alignerservice.com>

Sendt: 1. maj 2025 09:48
Til: Dit tandteam ApS <info@dittandteam.dk>
Emne: Re: Vurdering af Alignercase TrioClear #38474


 


Kære Karin


 


Så har jeg set etuppet igenne.


 


Det er ikke en nem case med meget IPR.


Der er stortset max IPR i OK for at mindkse HOB. Udfordringen er UK hvor vi også bliver nød til at lave IPR for at minimerer risikoen for retraktioner især på -1,2 som du skal
 holde øje med.


 


Der er ikke så meget vi kan gøre for at forbedre HOB.


Med hensyn til at fjerne en tand, så som nævnt vil det gøre bevægelserne mere komplexe og mere uforudsigelige.


 


Jeg kan se at teknikkerne nævner de sidste to skinner som overkorrektion. Når jeg ser på bevægelserne på de stadier, har det ikke noget med overkorrektion at gøre, men er regulær
 skinner.


 


Du skal holde øje med rotationerne i UK front. samt +1.


 






Husk at instruer patienten i at tygge skinnerne rigtigt godt ned over engagers og tænder, brug gerne bagenden af tandbørsten eller chewies, samt at bruge skinnerne
 22 timer i døgnet, for at minimerer risikoen for tracking issues.​​



For at hjælpe intrusioner på vej anbefaler jeg at tygge på skinnerne 3 gange om dagen i 5 min.


 


Jeg har vedhæftet en guide med tips og trick til at arbejde med aligners.


 





Sig endelig til hvis du har nogle spørgsmål.

Mastering Aligner Orthodontics: A Guide for General Dentists

Emne: Re:[## 24554 ##] Vurdering af Alignercase TrioClear #38474


 





Dear Karin,


 


Thank you for your email.


 


Case ID#38474 is moderate to complex, depending on the aspects you wish to treat. The patient presents with an overjet of 11.97 mm at
 the start of treatment. Extracting in the lower arch would increase the overjet further, so significant IPR is needed in the upper arch to reduce it.


 


If you prefer an extraction approach, removing #41 instead of #42 may allow easier space closure. Please avoid labial root movements
 on teeth with gingival recession (e.g., lower incisors, #23 etc). IPR should be limited to 0.3 mm in the upper anteriors and 0.5 mm distal to the canines to improve anterior aesthetics.


 


Treatment is expected to take around 11 months, with 2–3 additional aligners.


 


Alternatively, you can request a plan without extraction & correction of crowding using labial crown torque and IPR instead in lower
 anteriors. Please request no labial root movements in the lower anteriors to prevent worsening recession. IPR in the upper arch would still be required.


 


Let us know if you’d like support optimizing the setup—we’re happy to coordinate with the technicians.


 


Please feel free to reach out with any questions.


 






Kære Karin,

 
Tak for din e-mail.

 
Case ID#38474 er moderat til kompleks, afhængigt
 af de aspekter, du ønsker at behandle. Patienten har et overjet på 11,97 mm ved behandlingens start. Ekstraktion i den nedre tandbue vil øge overjet yderligere, så der er brug for betydelig IPR i den øvre tandbue for at reducere det.

 
Hvis du foretrækker en ekstraktionsmetode, kan
 det være lettere at lukke pladsen ved at fjerne nr. 41 i stedet for nr. 42. Undgå labiale rodbevægelser på tænder med gingival recession (f.eks. nedre fortænder, #23). IPR bør begrænses til 0,3 mm i de øvre anteriorer og 0,5 mm distalt for hjørnetænderne for
 at forbedre den anteriore æstetik.

 
Behandlingen forventes at tage omkring 11 måneder
 med 2-3 ekstra aligners.

 
Alternativt kan du anmode om en plan uden ekstraktion
 og korrektion af trængsel ved hjælp af labial kronedrejning og IPR i stedet i nedre anteriorer. Anmod venligst om ingen labiale rodbevægelser i de nedre anteriorer for at forhindre forværring af recession. IPR i overmunden vil stadig være påkrævet.

 
Sig til, hvis du gerne vil have hjælp til at optimere
 opsætningen - vi koordinerer gerne med teknikerne.
Du er velkommen til at kontakte os, hvis du har
 spørgsmål.

Emne: Re: Vurdering af Alignercase TrioClear #38474


 


Kære Karin


 


Så har jeg set etuppet igenne.


 


Det er ikke en nem case med meget IPR.


Der er stortset max IPR i OK for at mindkse HOB. Udfordringen er UK hvor vi også bliver nød til at lave IPR for at
 minimerer risikoen for retraktioner især på -1,2 som du skal holde øje med.


 


Der er ikke så meget vi kan gøre for at forbedre HOB.


Med hensyn til at fjerne en tand, så som nævnt vil det gøre bevægelserne mere komplexe og mere uforudsigelige.


 


Jeg kan se at teknikkerne nævner de sidste to skinner som overkorrektion. Når jeg ser på bevægelserne på de stadier,
 har det ikke noget med overkorrektion at gøre, men er regulær skinner.


 


Du skal holde øje med rotationerne i UK front. samt +1.


 






Husk at instruer patienten i at tygge skinnerne rigtigt godt ned over engagers og tænder, brug gerne bagenden
 af tandbørsten eller chewies, samt at bruge skinnerne 22 timer i døgnet, for at minimerer risikoen for tracking issues.​​



For at hjælpe intrusioner på vej anbefaler jeg at tygge på skinnerne 3 gange om dagen i 5 min.


 


Jeg har vedhæftet en guide med tips og trick til at arbejde med aligners.


 





Sig endelig til hvis du har nogle spørgsmål.

Dear Karin,


 


Thank you for your email.


 


Case ID#38474 is moderate to complex, depending on the aspects you wish to treat. The patient presents with an overjet of 11.97
 mm at the start of treatment. Extracting in the lower arch would increase the overjet further, so significant IPR is needed in the upper arch to reduce it.


 


If you prefer an extraction approach, removing #41 instead of #42 may allow easier space closure. Please avoid labial root
 movements on teeth with gingival recession (e.g., lower incisors, #23 etc). IPR should be limited to 0.3 mm in the upper anteriors and 0.5 mm distal to the canines to improve anterior aesthetics.


 


Treatment is expected to take around 11 months, with 2–3 additional aligners.


 


Alternatively, you can request a plan without extraction & correction of crowding using labial crown torque and IPR instead
 in lower anteriors. Please request no labial root movements in the lower anteriors to prevent worsening recession. IPR in the upper arch would still be required.


 


Let us know if you’d like support optimizing the setup—we’re happy to coordinate with the technicians.


 


Please feel free to reach out with any questions.


 






Kære Karin,

 
Tak for din e-mail.

 
Case ID#38474 er moderat til
 kompleks, afhængigt af de aspekter, du ønsker at behandle. Patienten har et overjet på 11,97 mm ved behandlingens start. Ekstraktion i den nedre tandbue vil øge overjet yderligere, så der er brug for betydelig IPR i den øvre tandbue for at reducere det.

 
Hvis du foretrækker en ekstraktionsmetode,
 kan det være lettere at lukke pladsen ved at fjerne nr. 41 i stedet for nr. 42. Undgå labiale rodbevægelser på tænder med gingival recession (f.eks. nedre fortænder, #23). IPR bør begrænses til 0,3 mm i de øvre anteriorer og 0,5 mm distalt for hjørnetænderne
 for at forbedre den anteriore æstetik.

 
Behandlingen forventes at
 tage omkring 11 måneder med 2-3 ekstra aligners.

 
Alternativt kan du anmode
 om en plan uden ekstraktion og korrektion af trængsel ved hjælp af labial kronedrejning og IPR i stedet i nedre anteriorer. Anmod venligst om ingen labiale rodbevægelser i de nedre anteriorer for at forhindre forværring af recession. IPR i overmunden vil stadig
 være påkrævet.

 
Sig til, hvis du gerne vil
 have hjælp til at optimere opsætningen - vi koordinerer gerne med teknikerne.
Du er velkommen til at kontakte
 os, hvis du har spørgsmål.

Kære Karin


 


Så har jeg set etuppet igenne.


 


Det er ikke en nem case med meget IPR.


Der er stortset max IPR i OK for at mindkse HOB. Udfordringen er UK hvor vi også bliver nød til at lave IPR for at minimerer risikoen for retraktioner især på -1,2 som du skal
 holde øje med.


 


Der er ikke så meget vi kan gøre for at forbedre HOB.


Med hensyn til at fjerne en tand, så som nævnt vil det gøre bevægelserne mere komplexe og mere uforudsigelige.


 


Jeg kan se at teknikkerne nævner de sidste to skinner som overkorrektion. Når jeg ser på bevægelserne på de stadier, har det ikke noget med overkorrektion at gøre, men er regulær
 skinner.


 


Du skal holde øje med rotationerne i UK front. samt +1.


 






Husk at instruer patienten i at tygge skinnerne rigtigt godt ned over engagers og tænder, brug gerne bagenden af tandbørsten eller chewies, samt at bruge skinnerne
 22 timer i døgnet, for at minimerer risikoen for tracking issues.​​



For at hjælpe intrusioner på vej anbefaler jeg at tygge på skinnerne 3 gange om dagen i 5 min.


 


Jeg har vedhæftet en guide med tips og trick til at arbejde med aligners.


 





Sig endelig til hvis du har nogle spørgsmål.

Fra: Priyanka Cherian <tps@alignerservice.com>

Sendt: 10. april 2025 09:12
Til: Dit tandteam ApS <info@dittandteam.dk>
Emne: Re:[## 24554 ##] Vurdering af Alignercase TrioClear #38474


 





Dear Karin,


 


Thank you for your email.


 


Case ID#38474 is moderate to complex, depending on the aspects you wish to treat. The patient presents with an overjet of 11.97 mm at
 the start of treatment. Extracting in the lower arch would increase the overjet further, so significant IPR is needed in the upper arch to reduce it.


 


If you prefer an extraction approach, removing #41 instead of #42 may allow easier space closure. Please avoid labial root movements
 on teeth with gingival recession (e.g., lower incisors, #23 etc). IPR should be limited to 0.3 mm in the upper anteriors and 0.5 mm distal to the canines to improve anterior aesthetics.


 


Treatment is expected to take around 11 months, with 2–3 additional aligners.


 


Alternatively, you can request a plan without extraction & correction of crowding using labial crown torque and IPR instead in lower
 anteriors. Please request no labial root movements in the lower anteriors to prevent worsening recession. IPR in the upper arch would still be required.


 


Let us know if you’d like support optimizing the setup—we’re happy to coordinate with the technicians.


 


Please feel free to reach out with any questions.


 






Kære Karin,

 
Tak for din e-mail.

 
Case ID#38474 er moderat til kompleks, afhængigt
 af de aspekter, du ønsker at behandle. Patienten har et overjet på 11,97 mm ved behandlingens start. Ekstraktion i den nedre tandbue vil øge overjet yderligere, så der er brug for betydelig IPR i den øvre tandbue for at reducere det.

 
Hvis du foretrækker en ekstraktionsmetode, kan
 det være lettere at lukke pladsen ved at fjerne nr. 41 i stedet for nr. 42. Undgå labiale rodbevægelser på tænder med gingival recession (f.eks. nedre fortænder, #23). IPR bør begrænses til 0,3 mm i de øvre anteriorer og 0,5 mm distalt for hjørnetænderne for
 at forbedre den anteriore æstetik.

 
Behandlingen forventes at tage omkring 11 måneder
 med 2-3 ekstra aligners.

 
Alternativt kan du anmode om en plan uden ekstraktion
 og korrektion af trængsel ved hjælp af labial kronedrejning og IPR i stedet i nedre anteriorer. Anmod venligst om ingen labiale rodbevægelser i de nedre anteriorer for at forhindre forværring af recession. IPR i overmunden vil stadig være påkrævet.

 
Sig til, hvis du gerne vil have hjælp til at optimere
 opsætningen - vi koordinerer gerne med teknikerne.
Du er velkommen til at kontakte os, hvis du har
 spørgsmål.

Fakturaen er stilet til tandlægen.dk Allerød.


 


Vi har også en faktura til tandlægen.dk Aalborg, hvor det er regulær en dobbelt betaling. Re - 00247


 


Det er begge tilbagevende kunder, og jeg arbejder i øjeblikket på cases for dem, som jo så skal faktureres, jeg vil da trække disse beløb fra overbetalingerne og lade jer vide

                                  bis komplexen Fall.
                                  Es gibt eine „cant“ in der

                                  Wurzelbewegungen benötigen, um sie zu
                                  korrigieren. Dies ist auch bei 32,42
                                  erforderlich.
                                  Ich würde die 3. Molaren nicht

                                  Bewegungen gibt.

Es handelt sich um einen mittelschweren Fall.
Wenn ich mir den Ausgangsbiss ansehe, sieht
                        es nach einem guten, stabilen Biss aus, so dass
                        ich keine Backenzahnbewegungen durchführen
                        würde.
Ich würde mich auf die Front konzentrieren,
                        um die Inklination und die Ausrichtung zu
                        verbessern. Das macht den Fall vorhersehbarer.
Ich sehe die Aufrichtung von 32, 42 als
                        größtes Problem aufgrund der vielen
                        Wurzelbewegungen.
Ich denke, dass eine ASR im oberen Bogen
                        erforderlich ist, um sicherzustellen, dass der
                        Überbiss nicht zu groß wird, und im unteren
                        Bogen, das Risiko von Zahnfleischrückgängen zu
                        verringern.


Ja, ich denke, dass das Setup geändert werden
                        muss.


Bitte lassen Sie mich wissen, ob ich das
                        Setup optimieren soll oder ob Sie noch Fragen
                        haben.

Agent replied: 'Guten Morgen, Herr Dr. Matthias Felsdas Setup für #2047311 ist nun bereit für Ihre Genehmigung.Es gibt viel ASR im unteren Bogen, um das Risiko von Gingivarezessionen zu minimieren. Ein wenig ASR auf der oberen rechten Seite, um die Mittellinie zu erhalten.Ich habe C-Ketten-Stufen hinzugefügt. Die letzten beiden Stufen sollten nur verwendet werden, wenn die Approximalkontakte am Ende der Behandlung zu locker sind. Sie sind dazu gedacht, die Kontaktpunkte zu straffen. Wenn die Kontaktpunkte in Ordnung sind, sollten Sie die letzten beiden Stufen nicht verwenden.Es gibt einige große Drehungen, die Sie im Auge behalten müssen. Es besteht die Gefahr, dass Probleme bei der Spurhaltung auftreten und Nachbesserungen erforderlich werden.Bitte denk daran, den Patienten anzuweisen, die Aligner fest auf die Zähne zu kauen, einschließlich der Engager, und die Aligner mindestens 22 Stunden pro Tag zu tragen. Dies wird dazu beitragen, Probleme mit dem Tracking zu minimieren. Ich empfehle außerdem, dass der Patient dreimal täglich fünf Minuten lang mit dem hinteren Ende einer Zahnbürste auf den Alignern kaut, um das Eindringen zu erleichtern.Ich habe eine Anleitung mit Tipps und Tricks für die Arbeit mit clearcorrect beigefügt.Bitte lassen Sie mich wissen, wenn Sie irgendwelche Fragen haben.Ich wünsche Ihnen einen schönen Tag.Book releaseMastering Aligner Orthodontics: A Guide for General DentistsCan be ordered at:Mastering Aligner Orthodontics | AlignerService.comOr buy directly on Amazonhttps://a.co/d/4pXzb1SKind regards / Venlig hilsen / Mit freundlichen Grüßen Helle Hatt DDSHelle@alignerservice.comAlignerservice.com-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------DisclaimerAlignerService consists of dentists and orthodontists with extensive clear aligner experience giving clinical advice to practising dentists and their teams. Individual results will vary.---- on Fri, 09 May 2025 07:34:22 +0200  Helle Hatt<tps@alignerservice.com>  wrote ---- Guten Morgen, Herr Dr. Matthias Felsdas Setup für #2047311 ist nun bereit für Ihre Genehmigung.Es gibt viel ASR im unteren Bogen, um das Risiko von Gingivarezessionen zu minimieren. Ein wenig ASR auf der oberen rechten Seite, um die Mittellinie zu erhalten.Ich habe C-Ketten-Stufen hinzugefügt. Die letzten beiden Stufen sollten nur verwendet werden, wenn die Approximalkontakte am Ende der Behandlung zu locker sind. Sie sind dazu gedacht, die Kontaktpunkte zu straffen. Wenn die Kontaktpunkte in Ordnung sind, sollten Sie die letzten beiden Stufen nicht verwenden.Es gibt einige große Drehungen, die Sie im Auge behalten müssen. Es besteht die Gefahr, dass Probleme bei der Spurhaltung auftreten und Nachbesserungen erforderlich werden.Bitte denk daran, den Patienten anzuweisen, die Aligner fest auf die Zähne zu kauen, einschließlich der Engager, und die Aligner mindestens 22 Stunden pro Tag zu tragen. Dies wird dazu beitragen, Probleme mit dem Tracking zu minimieren. Ich empfehle außerdem, dass der Patient dreimal täglich fünf Minuten lang mit dem hinteren Ende einer Zahnbürste auf den Alignern kaut, um das Eindringen zu erleichtern.Ich habe eine Anleitung mit Tipps und Tricks für die Arbeit mit clearcorrect beigefügt.Bitte lassen Sie mich wissen, wenn Sie irgendwelche Fragen haben.Ich wünsche Ihnen einen schönen Tag.Book releaseMastering Aligner Orthodontics: A Guide for General DentistsCan be ordered at:Mastering Aligner Orthodontics | AlignerService.comOr buy directly on Amazonhttps://a.co/d/4pXzb1SKind regards / Venlig hilsen / Mit freundlichen Grüßen Helle Hatt DDSHelle@alignerservice.comAlignerservice.com-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------DisclaimerAlignerService consists of dentists and orthodontists with extensive clear aligner experience giving clinical advice to practising dentists and their teams. Agent replied: 'Good morning BayarNot a problem.It was actually precisely to prevent HOB from becoming too large that I thought that crowns in the UK would also be a good idea.If we close the gaps in the UK, HOB will become larger.We can make it smaller by having smaller gaps in OK and/or adding more IPR.At this point, it is difficult to say precisely how large HOB will ultimately become.I would go through most of the treatment and then make provisionals, and then make a revision where it all can be fine-tuned.I hope that makes sense.Please let me know how you would like me to adjust the plan.I hope it helps.Book releaseMastering Aligner Orthodontics: A Guide for General DentistsCan be ordered at:Mastering Aligner Orthodontics | AlignerService.comOr buy directly on Amazonhttps://a.co/d/4pXzb1SKind regards / Venlig hilsen / Mit freundlichen Grüßen Helle Hatt DDSHelle@alignerservice.comAlignerservice.com-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------DisclaimerAlignerService consists of dentists and orthodontists with extensive clear aligner experience giving clinical advice to practising dentists and their teams. subject: case 2084593
content:
Customer asked: 'Hi, Thank you. What package is this? Kind regradsDr Karla Reigo Nybrogatan 44114 40 Stockholm08-661 04 41info@nybrokliniken.sewww.nybrokliniken.se Från: Priyanka Cherian [mailto:tps@alignerservice.com] Skickat: den 1 maj 2025 08:51Till: Karla ReigoÄmne: Re: case 2084593 Dear Karla, The setup for case #2084593 is now ready for your approval. No labial root movements were planned on the U3s due to gingival recession. Please keep an eye on the movement of teeth 14, 12, 22, and 23. Ensure that the engagers are seated correctly in the aligners to minimize tracking issues. Kindly remind the patient to chew the aligners firmly onto their teeth, including over the engagers, and to wear the aligners for at least 22 hours a day. This will help prevent tracking problems. At every recall appointment, please check the interproximal contacts of teeth planned for movement using dental floss to ensure there is adequate space for proper tracking. If the teeth are experiencing friction from adjacent ones, they may lose tracking. If interproximal contacts are too tight, use a polishing IPR strip (yellow in most color-coded IPR systems), which has a thickness of 0.08 mm, to relieve tight contacts. Please let me know if you have any questions.  Our new mail address for collaborator search is: helle@alignerservice.comCollaborator name is AlignerService Global TPS  Kind regards,Priyanka Cherian tps@alignerservice.comAlignerservice.comDisclaimer: AlignerService consists of dentists and orthodontists with extensive clear aligner experience, providing clinical advice to practicing dentists and their teams. Yes, please help me with this case because it´s my first clear correct case. I do not want the recessions 13-16 and 23-26 to be worse, but 25 needs to come out just a  little bit more for the buccal corridore.I want occlusal contacts also on 13 and 23. Kind regards/Karla Reigo Nybrogatan 44114 40 Stockholm08-661 04 41info@nybrokliniken.sewww.nybrokliniken.se Från: Helle Hatt [mailto:tps@alignerservice.com] Skickat: den 24 april 2025 11:18Till: karla@nybrokliniken.seÄmne: Re: case 2084593 Dear Karla The predictability indicators are showing you how predictable the movements are with the amount of movement that is desired.It does not mean that it is not possible to reach the final desired position it just mean that it can take longer to get there and that there is a higher risk of tracking issues. In your case, on 23, it is the mesial rotation and intrusion of 41,31. To make the movement more predictable, you can make the movement slower (more aligners), and for 23, I would add a bigger engager as well that increases the grip of the aligners to the tooth and then increases the predictability.The read triangles will still be there, but you know that the clinical predictability has been increased, and you should still look out for tracking issues and the risk of revisions. In general, the setup needs engagers for some of the big movements, some movements need to be optimised to be more predictable. There are recessions in the upper arch that, with this setup, will increase, so that also needs to be taken into account if you want to avoid that. If you need us to help you optimise and modify the setup, we will be happy to take over the communications with the technicians.We charge a fee for this service. I have attached our price list if you are interested in this.  Please let me know if you have any questions. Book releaseMastering Aligner Orthodontics: A Guide for General Dentists Can be ordered at:Mastering Aligner Orthodontics | AlignerService.comOr buy directly on Amazonhttps://a.co/d/4pXzb1S Kind regards / Venlig hilsen / Mit freundlichen Grüßen Helle Hatt DDS Helle@alignerservice.comAlignerservice.com  -----------------------------------------------------------------------------------Disclaimer AlignerService consists of dentists and orthodontists with extensive clear aligner experience giving clinical advice to practising dentists and their teams. Lieber Roberto,
vielen Dank – wir freuen uns sehr über Deine großartige Unterstützung und darüber, dass Dr. Sprintz sich für ClearCorrect entschieden hat!
Leider halte ich derzeit einen Kurs für Zahnärzt:innen in Italien – so weit in den Bergen, dass es weder WLAN noch Mobilfunknetz gibt.
Deshalb kann ich vor dem 4. Mai leider nicht persönlich zur Verfügung stehen.
Wenn das Gespräch auf Englisch (oder Deutsch) mit Helle stattfinden kann, steht dem aber nichts im Wege.
Gib uns gerne Bescheid, ob das für Dr. Sprintz in Ordnung ist – dann stimmt Helle gerne einen Termin ab.
Die Verrechnung der ersten drei Fälle über Straumann ist notiert – danke für die Info!

Jesper

 Herr Dr. Jesper,

ich
 freue mich, Ihnen mitteilen zu dürfen, dass ich heute einen neuen Kunden für Clear Correct gewinnen konnte Dr. Stefan Sprintz.

Gemeinsam
 mit einem zweiten Kollegen führt er eine neue, sehr schöne Zahnarztpraxis. Zuvor arbeitete er mit einem anderen Alignersystem, hat sich nun jedoch bewusst für einen Wechsel zu Clear Correct entschieden.

Dr.
 Sprintz würde die zukünftige Zusammenarbeit und Planungen gerne gemeinsam mit Ihnen und Frau Dr. Helle besprechen. 
Ich
 möchte Sie bitten, mir ein paar Terminvorschläge für ein kurzes Kennenlernen via Teams für die kommende Woche zu nennen, damit ich das Meeting entsprechend organisieren kann.

Bezüglich
 der ersten drei Fälle würde ich Sie bitten die wieder an Straumann zu verrechnen 

Vielen
 lieben Dank im Voraus und beste Grüße 
Roberto

Lieber Roberto,
vielen Dank – wir freuen uns sehr über Deine großartige Unterstützung und darüber, dass Dr. Sprintz sich für ClearCorrect entschieden hat!
Leider halte ich derzeit einen Kurs für Zahnärzt:innen in Italien – so weit in den Bergen, dass es weder WLAN noch Mobilfunknetz gibt.
Deshalb kann ich vor dem 4. Mai leider nicht persönlich zur Verfügung stehen.
Wenn das Gespräch auf Englisch (oder Deutsch) mit Helle stattfinden kann, steht dem aber nichts im Wege.
Gib uns gerne Bescheid, ob das für Dr. Sprintz in Ordnung ist – dann stimmt Helle gerne einen Termin ab.
Die Verrechnung der ersten drei Fälle über Straumann ist notiert – danke für die Info!
Beste Grüße
Jesper

AlignerService.com

ich

Dr.
 Sprintz würde die zukünftige Zusammenarbeit und Planungen gerne gemeinsam mit Ihnen und Frau Dr. Helle besprechen. 
Ich
 möchte Sie bitten, mir ein paar Terminvorschläge für ein kurzes Kennenlernen via Teams für die kommende Woche zu nennen, damit ich das Meeting entsprechend organisieren kann.

Bezüglich
 der ersten drei Fälle würde ich Sie bitten die wieder an Straumann zu verrechnen 

Vielen
 lieben Dank im Voraus und beste Grüße 
Roberto
 Pisati'

subject: info sent you Alistair Mackie via WeTransfer
content:
Customer asked: 'Dear Helle,
 
Just wanted to pass this on to let you know Spark have sent this through.
 
As I have not done this before, I wanted to ask :
 

Did you want to suggest any further specific instructions, or are you happy with the prescription?Would the midline discrepancy be altered or is that too complicated?Once I approve, what happens next?  I assume they then send me the video of before and after, the suggested number of aligners and time frame
 and instructions for IPR?Fees : Will they charge me for the set up and if so I need to take a payment from the patient.  How do I calculate how to charge a patient?Paperwork and consent : Do you have any templates regarding these important pieces of documentation?
 
Sorry for the list  - once I have an idea of what I need to put into place, I am sure moving forwards would be more straight forward.
 
Thank you 
 
Wayne
