subject: TPS Limited offer Pricing Strategy Suggestion
content:
Customer asked: 'Hi Priyanka,Thank you for thinking creatively and for such a thoughtful suggestion – I think it’s a great idea! I really like the approach and would be happy to move forward with it.That said, I’ve just returned from a week-long leadership course in Italy – with no internet or mobile access – and I’m currently digging my way out of a rather long to-do list. Once I’ve cleared a bit more space, I’ll get back to you so we can execute on this together.Thanks again – I really appreciate your initiative!
Kind regardsJesper Hatt DDSP: +41 78 268 00 78AlignerService.com

Den 28. apr. 2025 kl. 09.58 skrev Priyanka Cherian <pcherian1@outlook.com>:Hi Jesper,I hope you are well.I’ve been thinking about the pricing of TPS to be offered to colleagues in the UK, based on the discussion we had during our last monthly meeting. As I also work as the Clinical Content Manager for the ADA, I try to steer clear of direct promotion of TPS offerings, as it would present a conflict of interest between the two companies. Given how small the dental world is, I am not too comfortable having conversations with dentists accredited in Invisalign by the ADA to encourage them to take up our TPS.That said, I certainly want to boost the number of Aligner service cases. I have a suggestion — please feel free to disregard it if you feel it’s too radical.Perhaps we could run a limited-time offer during a week in May when the entire TPS team is available (for example, the week of May 11th). Dentists would be invited to pay whatever price they feel is fair for the service on two cases. We could promote this to a group, maybe a part of the list of 1,000 UK dentists I shared with you earlier.This idea is inspired by a restaurant model where no prices are listed on the menu, and customers are asked to pay what they feel is appropriate for the meal/service they received. The owner reported that hardly people took advantage of the system, and most customers ended up paying amounts similar to or more than what would have been the listed prices.It could also serve as a market assessment to gauge what price dentists are comfortable paying for TPS, helping us in future pricing decisions and discount campaigns.Please let me know your thoughts.Kind regards,Priyanka'
Agent replied: 'Dear  Priyanka CherianThank you for your mail.  will get back to you as soon as possible if a response is needed.Thank you for your patience.Kind regards / Venlig hilsen / Mit freundlichen Grüßen Helle Hatt DDS Tps@alignerservice.comAlignerservice.com'

+1,+2,+3 åbent bid samt +1 står forskudt aksial retning smlgn m 1+. Jeg er klar over Priyanka foreslår plast efter endt behandling.

Du må meget gerne lige se casen igennem.

Til: Anne-Birgitte Reersted <abr@fredtand.dk>
Emne: Re: Case # 2091721
 
















Dear Anne-Birgitte,


The setup for case #2091721 is now ready for your approval.


Aesthetic alignment has been planned for this case. Please note that the incisal wear on tooth #21 has become more prominent, which will benefit
 from restorative correction following orthodontic treatment.


Kindly keep an eye on the movements of teeth #14, #12, and #42. It’s important to ensure that the engagers are properly seated in the aligners
 to minimize the risk of tracking issues.


Please also remind the patient to bite down firmly on the aligners—particularly over the engagers—and to wear them for a minimum of 22 hours per
 day. This will help maintain optimal tracking throughout treatment.


Please feel free to reach out if you have any questions.








Kære Anne-Birgitte,


Opsætningen for case #2091721 er nu klar til din godkendelse.


Der er planlagt en æstetisk justering af dette tilfælde. Bemærk venligst, at det incisale slid på tand nr. 21 er blevet mere fremtrædende,
 hvilket vil have gavn af en restaurativ korrektion efter den ortodontiske behandling.


Hold venligst øje med bevægelserne af tand nr. 14, 12 og 42. Det er vigtigt at sikre, at engagers sidder korrekt i alignerne for
 at minimere risikoen for sporingsproblemer.


Mind også patienten om at bide godt fast i alignerne - især over engagementerne - og at have dem på i mindst 22 timer om dagen.
 Dette vil hjælpe med at opretholde optimal sporing under hele behandlingen.


Du er velkommen til at kontakte os, hvis du har spørgsmål.

Det eneste jeg tænkte på med +1,+2 var, at jeg er bange for, at der vil være for meget åbent bid i den region, samt at de stritter for meget. Ligeledes at der først er okklusion fra præmolarerne.

Kære Anne-Birgitte



Kan du beskrive at +1,2 er for facialt forskudt i forhold til hvad?



Jeg prøver at genetablere symerti i tandbuerne sam så det paser til ansigtet. 

Så ja der er forskel i incisalkants niveauet på 1+1, men det er fordi +1 skal slibes til mesialt.



Det kan være svært at visualisere sig slut resultatet, men jeg kan lave et DSD til dig mod betaling (95€)



Når du siger at patienten initialt kun ønskede behandlinging i UK, tænker jeg dog at det er uforsvareligt kun at behandle UK. Både da det er stort slid og trangstillig.

Forestil dig en patient kom og skulle have en rodbehandling, men kun ønskede den ene af de tre rodkanaler fyld og de to andre bare dækket til.

Det gør vi jo heller ikke.



Jeg håber det giver mening.



Sig endelig til hvordan du ønsker jeg skal fortsætte.

Jeg kan se hvad du mener.



Du fra patientens smil har +1 i hvert fald få lidt for meret distal krone kipning. Der er dog en cant på midtlinejen i forhold til ansigtets midtlinje.




Det er svært at ændre meget på det "åbne" bid i venstre side af fronten. Det vil kræve noget mere IPR.



Kan jeg få dig til at gå ind på DR stadiet. Trykke på DR knappen til højre for tidslinjen og fortælle mig om det var mere ala det du tænkte.

Kære Anne-Birgitte




Kan du beskrive at +1,2 er for facialt forskudt i forhold til hvad?




Jeg prøver at genetablere symerti i tandbuerne sam så det paser til ansigtet. 

Så ja der er forskel i incisalkants niveauet på 1+1, men det er fordi +1 skal slibes til mesialt.




Det kan være svært at visualisere sig slut resultatet, men jeg kan lave et DSD til dig mod betaling (95€)




Når du siger at patienten initialt kun ønskede behandlinging i UK, tænker jeg dog at det er uforsvareligt kun at behandle UK. Både da det er stort slid og trangstillig.

Det gør vi jo heller ikke.




Jeg håber det giver mening.




Sig endelig til hvordan du ønsker jeg skal fortsætte.

Dear Anne-Birgitte,


The setup for case #2091721 is now ready for your approval.


Aesthetic alignment has been planned for this case. Please note that the incisal wear on tooth #21 has become more prominent,
 which will benefit from restorative correction following orthodontic treatment.


Kindly keep an eye on the movements of teeth #14, #12, and #42. It’s important to ensure that the engagers are properly seated
 in the aligners to minimize the risk of tracking issues.


Please also remind the patient to bite down firmly on the aligners—particularly over the engagers—and to wear them for a minimum
 of 22 hours per day. This will help maintain optimal tracking throughout treatment.


Please feel free to reach out if you have any questions.






Kære Anne-Birgitte,




Opsætningen for case #2091721 er nu klar til din godkendelse.




Der er planlagt en æstetisk justering af dette tilfælde. Bemærk venligst, at det incisale slid på tand nr. 21 er blevet mere fremtrædende, hvilket vil have gavn af en restaurativ korrektion efter den ortodontiske behandling.




Hold venligst øje med bevægelserne af tand nr. 14, 12 og 42. Det er vigtigt at sikre, at engagers sidder korrekt i alignerne for at minimere risikoen for sporingsproblemer.




Mind også patienten om at bide godt fast i alignerne - især over engagementerne - og at have dem på i mindst 22 timer om dagen. Dette vil hjælpe med at opretholde optimal sporing under hele behandlingen.




Du er velkommen til at kontakte os, hvis du har spørgsmål.

subject: Indeksering af case
content:
Customer asked: 'Kære Helle
 
Tak for mailen! Patienten er egentlig frisk på behandling, men er nervøs for om tungepresse vil påvirke et eventuelt nyt resultat. Så hun vil gerne lige øve sig i at minimere dette
 før behandling 😊
 
Rigtig god dag!

Trine

2600 Glostrup

43454848
www.glostruptandplejecenter.dk

Sendt: 29. april 2025 15:15
Til: Glostrup Tandplejecenter <info@glostruptandplejecenter.dk>
Emne: Re: Indeksering af case


 


Kære Trine


 


Det er en moderat case, men i den nemmere ende. Grunden til at det ikke er en simpel case er at der er relapse i proklinationen. Dette kunne tyde på at tungen skubber tænderne
 frem.


For at få retroklineret tænderne lidt vil det kræve lidt IPR.


Jeg ville ikke flytte molar og premolar kun fokusere på fronten.


 


Behandlingstid 6-8 måneder.

Customer asked: 'Hello Priyanka,




Thank you for the treatment planning. I think patient would be happy with the treatment if we stop at step 12. Would that result be stable? And which plan would you recomand for that? 




I will show him both options, so please don't change anything to the plan yet but I wanted to know what our options are. 




Thank you,




Sophie














From: Priyanka Cherian <tps@alignerservice.com>
Sent: Tuesday, May 6, 2025 3:55 AM
To: Sophie Deraedt <sophie@tandartss.be>
Subject: Re: TPS #2092934
 
















Dear Sophie,


The setup for case #2092934 is now ready for your approval.


There is IPR planned in the lower arch to help alleviate crowding while maintaining some overjet.


Please keep an eye on the movement of teeth 11, 23, 33, and 32. Ensure that the engagers are properly seated in the aligners to minimize any tracking
 issues.


Kindly remind the patient to bite down firmly on the aligners—including over the engagers—and to wear them for at least 22 hours a day. This will
 help reduce the risk of tracking problems.


Please let me know if you have any questions.




















Our

Collaborator

 regards,

Agent replied: 'Dear Sophie,Thank you for the email.In the current plan, the treatment is scheduled over 18 aligners. The optional final two aligners (aligners 19 and 20) are space-closure aligners to be used only if residual spacing remains in the arch. If they are not needed, they can be discarded.I recommend planning treatment over 17 to 18 aligners, as tooth #33 presents with a 17.9° labial crown tip. For efficient orthodontic tooth movement, we typically recommend:1° per aligner for tipping/torquing2° per aligner for rotation0.2 mm per aligner for translation (intrusion, extrusion, or labial/lingual movement)While teeth can be digitally aligned faster, biological constraints like bone remodeling often cannot keep up, leading to loss of tracking and the need for additional aligners.If needed, treatment could be stopped at 12 aligners. In that case, some aesthetic alignment may remain unfinished, but the occlusion and canine guidance would already be properly established, making it a clinically acceptable point to stop.Please let me know if you have any questions or would like to adjust the plan.Our new mail address for collaborator search is: helle@alignerservice.comCollaborator name is AlignerService Global TPS  Kind regards,Priyanka Cherian tps@alignerservice.comAlignerservice.comDisclaimer:AlignerService consists of dentists and orthodontists with extensive clear aligner experience, providing clinical advice to practicing dentists and their teams. Customer asked: 'Dear Helle,
 
I am not so much afraid about the consequences of guidance on the lateral. I will forsure follow it up.
Please submit the changes.
 
Luk 
 


Van: Helle Hatt <tps@alignerservice.com>

Verzonden: dinsdag 6 mei 2025 8:16
Aan: Tandartspraktijk Luk Daneels <luk@tandartsdaneels.be>
Onderwerp: Re: #2096860


 



Good morning Luk


 


Thank you for your email.


 


I have now tried to redistribute the IPR so that we have less. mostly 0.2, but is it okay for you with 0.3 posterior?


You can see what I have done on the DR button.


 


I have one concern, though, and that is the functional occlusion. The lower canine will occlude on the upper laterals. This can potentially lead to fracture of the lateral because
 some of the canine guidance is on the laterals, and the laterals are not as strong as the canines, that is why I initially made more IPR posterior.


 


I hope it makes sense. 


Please let me know if you are okay with it all, and I will submit the changes.


 


Thank you.

wrote ---- 






Dear Helle,
 
I like the result, but Tobias has a thin enamel layer and most of his teeth are intact.
Can we reach a good result with less IPR ( Max .2mm per interproximal space)?
As you know I don’t mind having contacts at the frontteeth.
 
Kind regards,
 
Luk
 


Van: Helle Hatt <tps@alignerservice.com>

Verzonden: vrijdag 2 mei 2025 14:48
Aan: Tandartspraktijk Luk Daneels <luk@tandartsdaneels.be>
Onderwerp: Re: #2096860


 






Dear Luk


 


The setup on #2096860 is now ready for your approval.


 


There is IPR in the lower arch to solve the crowding and keep a positive overjet.


 


Please look out for the rotations of the lower canines.


 






Please remember to instruct the patient to chew the aligners firmly onto their teeth, including the engagers, and to wear them for at least 22 hours a day. This will
 help minimise any tracking issues. I also recommend that the patient chews on the aligners using the back end of a toothbrush or chewies three times a day for five minutes to assist with the intrusion.


 




Please let me know if you have any questions.









 


I had a look at your preferences, and they look fine. Just one thing you can choose not to remove the engagers for revisions. That saves you charge time.

Onderwerp: Re: #2096860


 






Dear Luk


 


The setup on #2096860 is now ready for your approval.


 


There is IPR in the lower arch to solve the crowding and keep a positive overjet.


 


Please look out for the rotations of the lower canines.


 






Please remember to instruct the patient to chew the aligners firmly onto their teeth, including the engagers, and to wear them for at least 22 hours a day. This will help minimise
 any tracking issues. I also recommend that the patient chews on the aligners using the back end of a toothbrush or chewies three times a day for five minutes to assist with the intrusion.


 




Please let me know if you have any questions.









 


I had a look at your preferences, and they look fine. Just one thing you can choose not to remove the engagers for revisions. That saves you charge time.

Verzonden: dinsdag 6 mei 2025 8:16
Aan: Tandartspraktijk Luk Daneels <luk@tandartsdaneels.be>
Onderwerp: Re: #2096860


 



Good morning Luk


 


Thank you for your email.


 


I have now tried to redistribute the IPR so that we have less. mostly 0.2, but is it okay for you with 0.3 posterior?


You can see what I have done on the DR button.


 


I have one concern, though, and that is the functional occlusion. The lower canine will occlude on the upper laterals. This can potentially lead to fracture of the
 lateral because some of the canine guidance is on the laterals, and the laterals are not as strong as the canines, that is why I initially made more IPR posterior.


 


I hope it makes sense. 


Please let me know if you are okay with it all, and I will submit the changes.


 


Thank you.

Dear Luk


 


The setup on #2096860 is now ready for your approval.


 


There is IPR in the lower arch to solve the crowding and keep a positive overjet.


 


Please look out for the rotations of the lower canines.


 






Please remember to instruct the patient to chew the aligners firmly onto their teeth, including the engagers, and to wear them for at least 22 hours a day. This will
 help minimise any tracking issues. I also recommend that the patient chews on the aligners using the back end of a toothbrush or chewies three times a day for five minutes to assist with the intrusion.


 




Please let me know if you have any questions.

subject: TPS 2075514
content:
Customer asked: 'Dear Priyanka,



Thank you for your quick reply.
Ok, we’ll keep it the way it is.
We’ll see at the end. You don’t need to change it now.


Kind regards,
Laura Helsen


Op 7 mei 2025 om 15:50 heeft Priyanka Cherian <tps@alignerservice.com> het volgende geschreven:




﻿



Dear Laura,


Thank you for your email.


There is good occlusion at the end of treatment. Occlusal contacts have been intentionally avoided on the incisors to prevent premature anterior contact, which could increase the risk of a posterior open bite.


An overbite of 2 mm is present at the end of treatment. Due to incisal wear and the rounded shape of the incisors—especially the lateral incisors—it may give the impression of an open bite. I would recommend keeping it as planned, as the intrusion
 planned on the lower anteriors is unlikely to fully track. The setup slightly over-engineers the movement, so the actual overbite may end up deeper than 2 mm, which should help resolve the issue.


The open gingival embrasure between teeth 12 and 11 appears more prominent in the digital setup. This is because setups do not accurately predict the gingival response—so the "black triangles" may not be as noticeable clinically. If they are still
 prominent at the end of treatment, we can add minor IPR and complete the refinement with a few additional aligners. If you'd prefer, I can include the IPR in the current setup as well, just let me know & I will modify it.


Please let me know if you have any questions.











Our
 new mail address for collaborator search is: helle@alignerservice.com
Collaborator
 name is AlignerService Global TPS 
 
Kind
 regards,


Priyanka Cherian 
tps@alignerservice.com

Customer asked: 'Dear Priyanka,
 
 
Okay, looks good.
Only one thing that I want to ask;

Is there occlusion in the front region at the end of treatment?
It looks that there is a small ‘open bite’ in the front (12-11-21-22).
 
Kind regards,
Laura Helsen
 


Van: Priyanka Cherian <tps@alignerservice.com>

Verzonden: donderdag 1 mei 2025 8:58
Aan: Laura Helsen <LauraHelsen@tmzg.be>
Onderwerp: Re: TPS 2075514


 














Dear Laura,
 
The setup for case #2075514 is now ready for your approval.
 
IPR has been added in the lower arch to gain overjet.
 
Please keep an eye on the movement of teeth 14, 11, 23, 24, and 43. Ensure that the engagers are seated correctly in the aligners
 to minimize tracking issues.
 
Kindly remind the patient to chew the aligners firmly onto their teeth, including over the engagers, and to wear them for at least
 22 hours per day. This will help minimize any tracking problems.
 
At every recall appointment, please check the interproximal contacts of teeth planned for movement using dental floss to confirm there
 is enough space for effective tracking. Teeth may lose tracking if they encounter friction from adjacent ones. If the interproximal contacts are too tight, you can use a polishing IPR strip (yellow in most color-coded IPR systems, thickness: 0.08 mm) to relieve
 tight contacts.
 
Please let me know if you have any questions.

Agent replied: 'Dear Laura,Thank you for your email.There is good occlusion at the end of treatment. Occlusal contacts have been intentionally avoided on the incisors to prevent premature anterior contact, which could increase the risk of a posterior open bite.An overbite of 2 mm is present at the end of treatment. Due to incisal wear and the rounded shape of the incisors—especially the lateral incisors—it may give the impression of an open bite. I would recommend keeping it as planned, as the intrusion planned on the lower anteriors is unlikely to fully track. The setup slightly over-engineers the movement, so the actual overbite may end up deeper than 2 mm, which should help resolve the issue.The open gingival embrasure between teeth 12 and 11 appears more prominent in the digital setup. This is because setups do not accurately predict the gingival response—so the "black triangles" may not be as noticeable clinically. If they are still prominent at the end of treatment, we can add minor IPR and complete the refinement with a few additional aligners. If you'd prefer, I can include the IPR in the current setup as well, just let me know & I will modify it.Please let me know if you have any questions.Our new mail address for collaborator search is: helle@alignerservice.comCollaborator name is AlignerService Global TPS  Kind regards,Priyanka Cherian tps@alignerservice.comAlignerservice.comDisclaimer:AlignerService consists of dentists and orthodontists with extensive clear aligner experience, providing clinical advice to practicing dentists and their teams. Agent replied: 'Sehr geehrte Frau Bediadas Setup zu #2070271 ist nun bereit für Ihre Genehmigung.Die Zähne wurden in den aktuellen Bögen ausgerichtet.Es gibt eine Menge ASR im oberen Bogen, um sicherzustellen, dass wir den oberen Bogen nicht überragen und einen größeren Überbiss erzeugen.Die letzten beiden Stufen sollten nur verwendet werden, wenn die Approximalkontakte am Ende der Behandlung zu locker sind. Sie sind dazu gedacht, die Kontaktpunkte zu straffen. Wenn die Kontaktpunkte in Ordnung sind, sollten Sie die letzten beiden Stufen nicht verwenden.Die Lücken im Unterkiefer sind geschlossen.Vor allem an den Zähnen 12, 22 und 43 gibt es viel Bewegung, so dass Sie auf das Risiko von Tracking-Problemen achten müssen.Bitte denk daran, den Patienten anzuweisen, die Aligner fest auf die Zähne zu kauen, einschließlich der Engager, und die Aligner mindestens 22 Stunden pro Tag zu tragen. Dies wird dazu beitragen, Probleme mit dem Tracking zu minimieren. Ich empfehle außerdem, dass der Patient dreimal täglich fünf Minuten lang mit dem hinteren Ende einer Zahnbürste auf den Alignern kaut, um das Eindringen zu erleichtern.Ich habe eine Anleitung mit Tipps und Tricks zur Arbeit mit ClearCorrect beigefügt.Bitte lassen Sie mich wissen, wenn Sie irgendwelche Fragen haben.​Ich wünsche Ihnen einen schönen Tag.Book releaseMastering Aligner Orthodontics: A Guide for General DentistsCan be ordered at:Mastering Aligner Orthodontics | AlignerService.comOr buy directly on Amazonhttps://a.co/d/4pXzb1SKind regards / Venlig hilsen / Mit freundlichen Grüßen Helle Hatt DDSHelle@alignerservice.comAlignerservice.com-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------DisclaimerAlignerService consists of dentists and orthodontists with extensive clear aligner experience giving clinical advice to practising dentists and their teams. subject: Fallplanung Fall ID 2097920
content:
Customer asked: 'Betreff: Rückmeldung zum BehandlungsplanGuten Tag Frau Dr. Helle-Hatt,vielen Dank für Ihre Einschätzung und den Vorschlag zum weiteren Vorgehen.Für die Patientin kommt momentan leider keine Lösung mit indirekten/direkten Versorgungen in Frage. Wie hoch sehen ist das Risiko einer Schlafapnoe?Lässt sich ein Rückfallrisiko minimieren, wenn zusätzlich zum geklebten Retainer eine darüberliegende Nachtschiene angefertigt wird?Gäbe es eine Möglichkeit mit weniger Veneers z.B. nur im OK? Pat. lässt sich eventuell leichter überzeugen bei weniger Stellen.Vielen Dank!Ich freue mich auf Ihre Rückmeldung und danke Ihnen im Voraus.Mit freundlichen GrüßenDaniela i.A Dr.Morocutti       Von: Helle Hatt <tps@alignerservice.com> Gesendet: Montag, 5. Mai 2025 08:39An: praxis@smilezeit.atBetreff: Re: Fallplanung Fall ID 2097920 Guten Morgen Frau Deniela Ich habe mir die Fotos und den ersten Setup-Vorschlag angesehen. Ich würde nicht empfehlen, alle Zähne zurückzuziehen, um die Lücken zu schließen.Ich sehe, dass die Zunge bereits die Lücken zwischen den Zähnen ausfüllt, was darauf hindeutet, dass die Zunge groß ist und eine Funktionsstörung aufweist. In diesem Fall besteht ein sehr hohes Risiko für einen Rückfall, wenn Sie alle Zähne zurückziehen, da die Zunge dann in den Hals fällt und Schlafapnoe verursachen kann. In diesem Fall würde ich empfehlen, die Zähne so auszurichten, dass die Lücken zwischen den Zähnen gleichmäßig verteilt sind, und dann Veneers ohne Präparation anzubringen. Bitte lassen Sie mich wissen, ob dieser Plan für Sie in Ordnung ist, dann werde ich das Setup für Sie fortsetzen.Vielen Dank.Ich wünsche Ihnen einen schönen Tag. Book releaseMastering Aligner Orthodontics: A Guide for General Dentists Can be ordered at:Mastering Aligner Orthodontics | AlignerService.comOr buy directly on Amazonhttps://a.co/d/4pXzb1S Kind regards / Venlig hilsen / Mit freundlichen Grüßen Helle Hatt DDS Helle@alignerservice.comAlignerservice.com  -----------------------------------------------------------------------------------Disclaimer AlignerService consists of dentists and orthodontists with extensive clear aligner experience giving clinical advice to practising dentists and their teams. Based on information achieved through the doctor portal of the doctor's preferred clear aligner system (Invisalign, ClearCorrect, SureSmile, Spark), AlignerService offers tentative orthodontic diagnostics, orthodontic treatment planning, optimization of digital treatment plans, and treatment support.  AlignerService never has physical contact with the patients or the doctor. The doctor is solely responsible for prescribing and administering orthodontic treatment and maintaining all patient medical records.  Treatment Planning Services received from AlignerService shall only be considered as recommendations and the ultimate decision on whether or not to apply the Treatment Planning Services or to adapt them to the conditions of the specific patient remains with the treating doctor.  AlignerService shall not become liable for any damages, claims, liabilities, etc. that may result or arise in context with the Treatment Planning Services provided to the doctor.Clear aligner therapy is unpredictable. Customer asked: 'Danke für die schnelle Rückmeldung! Wie würde der Behandlungsplan aussehen, wenn wir nur den OK behandeln und der Patientin dann vorschlagen Veniers zu machen! Bitte einen Behandlungsplan dafür erstellen Würde ein kleiner Behandlungsplan mit weniger Kosten möglich sein Wie ---ONE--- Mini oder Two Mit freundlichen GrüßenIhr Praxisteam Smilezeit - ZahnarztpraxisDr. Dominic MorocuttiUntere Hauptstraße 1148181 St. Ruprecht an der Raab 03178/215 14praxis@smilezeit.atwww.smilezeit.at  Von: Helle Hatt <tps@alignerservice.com> Gesendet: Montag, 5. Mai 2025 17:04An: Praxis <praxis@smilezeit.at>Betreff: Re: Fallplanung Fall ID 2097920 Sehr geehrte Frau Daniela Leider besteht in diesem Fall ein fast 100-prozentiges Risiko für Schlafapnoe. Der mittlere Teil des Gesichts ist konkav. Es sieht so aus, als hätte der Patient bereits Atemprobleme.Um diesen Fall optimal zu behandeln, wären chirurgische Veränderungen im mittleren Gesichtsbereich erforderlich. Die Erfolgsquote mit einer Nachtschiene ist in solchen Fällen leider sehr gering. Auch bei geklebten Retainern besteht ein hohes Risiko, dass sie sich lösen oder der gesamte vordere Zahnbereich durch die Zunge nach vorne gedrückt wird. Um die Behandlung kostengünstiger zu gestalten, könnten wir zunächst nur den Oberkiefer behandeln und anstelle von Veneers die "injection molding“-Technik anwenden. Ich hoffe, das hilft Ihnen weiter. Book releaseMastering Aligner Orthodontics: A Guide for General Dentists Can be ordered at:Mastering Aligner Orthodontics | AlignerService.comOr buy directly on Amazonhttps://a.co/d/4pXzb1S Kind regards / Venlig hilsen / Mit freundlichen Grüßen Helle Hatt DDS Helle@alignerservice.comAlignerservice.com  -----------------------------------------------------------------------------------Disclaimer AlignerService consists of dentists and orthodontists with extensive clear aligner experience giving clinical advice to practising dentists and their teams. Der mittlere Teil des Gesichts ist konkav. Es sieht so aus, als hätte der Patient bereits Atemprobleme.Um diesen Fall optimal zu behandeln, wären chirurgische Veränderungen im mittleren Gesichtsbereich erforderlich. Die Erfolgsquote mit einer Nachtschiene ist in solchen Fällen leider sehr gering. Auch bei geklebten Retainern besteht ein hohes Risiko, dass sie sich lösen oder der gesamte vordere Zahnbereich durch die Zunge nach vorne gedrückt wird. Um die Behandlung kostengünstiger zu gestalten, könnten wir zunächst nur den Oberkiefer behandeln und anstelle von Veneers die "injection molding“-Technik anwenden. Ich hoffe, das hilft Ihnen weiter. Book releaseMastering Aligner Orthodontics: A Guide for General Dentists Can be ordered at:Mastering Aligner Orthodontics | AlignerService.comOr buy directly on Amazonhttps://a.co/d/4pXzb1S Kind regards / Venlig hilsen / Mit freundlichen Grüßen Helle Hatt DDS Helle@alignerservice.comAlignerservice.com  -----------------------------------------------------------------------------------Disclaimer AlignerService consists of dentists and orthodontists with extensive clear aligner experience giving clinical advice to practising dentists and their teams. Wie hoch sehen ist das Risiko einer Schlafapnoe?Lässt sich ein Rückfallrisiko minimieren, wenn zusätzlich zum geklebten Retainer eine darüberliegende Nachtschiene angefertigt wird?Gäbe es eine Möglichkeit mit weniger Veneers z.B. nur im OK? In diesem Fall besteht ein sehr hohes Risiko für einen Rückfall, wenn Sie alle Zähne zurückziehen, da die Zunge dann in den Hals fällt und Schlafapnoe verursachen kann. In diesem Fall würde ich empfehlen, die Zähne so auszurichten, dass die Lücken zwischen den Zähnen gleichmäßig verteilt sind, und dann Veneers ohne Präparation anzubringen. Bitte lassen Sie mich wissen, ob dieser Plan für Sie in Ordnung ist, dann werde ich das Setup für Sie fortsetzen.Vielen Dank.Ich wünsche Ihnen einen schönen Tag. Book releaseMastering Aligner Orthodontics: A Guide for General Dentists Can be ordered at:Mastering Aligner Orthodontics | AlignerService.comOr buy directly on Amazonhttps://a.co/d/4pXzb1S Kind regards / Venlig hilsen / Mit freundlichen Grüßen Helle Hatt DDS Helle@alignerservice.comAlignerservice.com  -----------------------------------------------------------------------------------Disclaimer AlignerService consists of dentists and orthodontists with extensive clear aligner experience giving clinical advice to practising dentists and their teams. Customer asked: 'Så har jeg talt med Patienten . Helle han er til at starte med mere tryg ved at beholde tanden -2. Han ligger meget vægt at vi skal prøve at bevarer tanden .  Han er dog enig i at hvis vi på et tidspunkt fortæller ham at den skal fjernes, vil han acc det. 





Med venlig hilsen

Uzma Riaz
Tandplejer og ClearCorrect ansvarlig
Godt Smil Tandlægerne

Telefon: +45 44 22 41 32
E-mail: uzma.riaz@godtsmil.dk

Sendt: 1. maj 2025 21:42
Til: tps@alignerservice.com <tps@alignerservice.com>
Emne: Sv: Sagsnr. 2099232
 



Patienten ønsker at vi gør det som skal til får at få et bedre bid og smil. Jeg kan tale med ham om at vi anb Ex af -2. alternativt hvis han ønsker at vi går videre uden Ex , vil jeg informere ham om de unødvendige bevægelser på -3. hvis vi måske alligevel
 ikke kan komme i mål uden Ex. Jeg ser ham her i næste uge, se hvordan han ønsker vi gør. 

Jeg vender tilbage til dig 🙂 





Med venlig hilsen

Uzma Riaz

Warning: This email originated from outside of Godt Smil’s trusted e-mail environment. Do not click any links or open attachments unless you recognize
 the sender and have confidence the content is safe.

 











Kære Uzma



Jeg syntes at det er lidt udfordrende, da det smarteste vil være at fjerne -2 hvis der er nogen der skal fjernes. Hvis i går i gang med behandlingen og prøver at rette med uden ex som udgangspunkt og ombestemmer, så vil der være nogle unødige bevægelser
 på -3 og evt noget IPR posterior som ikke skulle være lavet.



Jeg vil anbefale at få to forskellige setup så i kan se hvad forskellen er og derved tage beslutning og informerer patienten om konsekvenser for det ene og det andet på et mere oplyst grundlag.



Jeg håber det giver mening.

Warning: This email originated from outside of Godt Smil’s trusted e-mail environment. Do not click any links or open attachments unless you recognize
 the sender and have confidence the content is safe.

 











Godmorgen Uzma



Så er setuppet på #2099232 klar til din godkendelse.



Som nævnt en del IPR i UK, og store bevægelser på -1,2,3 som i skal holde øje med.

Der er også en del rotation på 3-.

I OK er det 3,2+2, som i skal holde øje med.


Vær forberedt på at det kan være meget udfordrende at få placeret skinnerne i UK til at starte med.







Husk
 at instruer patienten i at tygge skinnerne rigtigt godt ned over engagers og tænder, brug gerne bagenden af tandbørsten eller chewies, samt at bruge skinnerne 22 timer i døgnet, for at minimerer risikoen for tracking issues.


For at hjælpe intrusioner på vej anbefaler jeg at tygge på skinnerne 3 gange om dagen i 5 min.





Vedhæftet
 finder du orto journalen.






Sig
 endelig til hvis du har nogle spørgsmål.

content:

Thank you for your reply. I will gladly pay you a visit in Baden.

 
So lets meet in your office at 2pm next Monday if that suits you and Helle? I will be accompanied by Samira Slag who is our Digital Sales Specialist for Switzerland.
 
Regards
Andreas
 




Andreas Gruber
Regional Sales Director DACH | Ormco

andreas.gruber@envistaco.com

ormco.de
 | sparkaligners.com

 
 
     
 




Ormco and Spark are part of Envista, a global family of more than 30 trusted dental brands, united by a shared purpose:
to partner with professionals to improve lives.





 
 
 
 


From: Jesper Alignerservice <jesper@alignerservice.com>

Sent: Monday, May 5, 2025 9:05 AM
To: Gruber, Andreas <andreas.gruber@envistaco.com>
Subject: Meeting on May 12th in Baden 


 
Dear Andreas,
Thank you so much for your message – and apologies for my late reply.
I’ve just returned from facilitating a leadership retreat for dentists in a remote part of Italy, where we had very limited access to both WiFi and mobile networks. It’s been intense but truly rewarding.
Helle and I would be delighted to meet with you on May 12th in Baden – we’re both available and quite flexible that day, so please let us know what time works best for you.
We’re looking forward to continuing our IDS conversation and exploring ideas together.






Best regards
Jesper Hatt DDS

P: +41 78 268 00 78

AlignerService.com


 

 

 

 







Den 1. maj 2025 kl. 17.13 skrev Gruber, Andreas <andreas.gruber@envistaco.com>:

 


Dear Jesper,


 


I hope all is going well for you?


 


I happen to visit Switzerland on 12th May and am wondering whether you would be available for a meeting in the afternoon
 or evening in Baden? We could continue our discussion from IDS.


 


Best regards


Andreas


 






Andreas Gruber


Regional Sales Director DACH | Ormco


andreas.gruber@envistaco.com


M: +49 175 743 7696 | Germany


ormco.de | sparkaligners.com

 partner with professionals to improve lives.

<image006.png>






 


 


 


 




From: Jesper
 Alignerservice <jesper@alignerservice.com>
Sent: Thursday, April 3, 2025 8:31 AM
To: Gruber, Andreas <andreas.gruber@envistaco.com>
Subject: TPS collaboration opportunity – follow-up from IDS




 

Dear Andreas,
Thank you again for the conversation at IDS. Helle and I appreciated the chance to introduce AlignerService—and we hope you've had a moment to flip through the copy of Mastering
 Aligner Orthodontics we gave you at the booth.
As discussed, we’re seeing a clear rise in demand for Treatment Planning Support (TPS) among
 Spark providers, especially general practitioners. We’d like to explore a collaboration, where
 Spark clinics can access our services—helping them succeed, while also strengthening your brand.



What we offer Spark providers:
➡️ Free case selection
 within 24 hours


Dentist uploads case to the Spark Doctor Portal and emails us the case number
We respond with case classification (easy/moderate/complex/refer), short rationale, and estimated treatment duration
➡️ TPS service – €212 per case


We co-plan treatment with the dentist (no rigid pre-made setups)
Especially helpful for ortho-restorative cases
Includes refinements and full support throughout treatment



Why this benefits Spark:
✔️ Fewer revision requests →
 lower internal workload and reduced aligner production costs
✔️ Less strain on Spark’s
 clinical support team – We handle support for the cases we manage (unless you prefer otherwise – we adapt to each manufacturer’s preference)
✔️ More confident and satisfied
 providers – Less time wasted, more predictable outcomes



As mentioned, we don’t see AI (yet) as a reliable replacement for expert-driven planning—especially for complex aligner cases. We're excited about where the tech is heading, but for now,
 clinics need a clinically grounded partner.
Let us know if you'd be open to a quick call to explore potential next steps.
Best regards,
Jesper Hatt
Co-Founder, AlignerService.com
📞 +41
 78 268 0078 / +45 6127 2228
📧 mail@hattconsulting.com
🌐 www.alignerservice.com

subject: J. Bonnesen 2100898
content:
Customer asked: 'Kære HelleLænge siden, håber alt er vel hos jer. Jeg har en ny case Jens, som ønsker lige tænder i underkæben, og han har progredierende slid. I højre side har vi lagt plast på 3+ for nogle måneder siden til genetablering af hjønetandsføring. Dette trives han rigtig godt med. Problemet ligger i hans venstre side.Pga biddet i venstre side hjælper det ikke at lægge plast på. Derfor vil jeg høre dig ad om du mener vi kan extrudere hans -3 og få plads til den i tandrækken. Hvor meget IPR vil det kræve grundet trang stillingen ?Er prognosen god?Jeg har kun et enkelt problem hos ham, og det er +7 ,som har stort fæstetab og knoglesvind omkring den. Der har siddet en +8 indtil jeg overtog ham for 6 år siden (pillede den hurtigt ud) , der er lavet paro kir med Emdogain efterfølgende, og inflammationsmæssigt er der lav BOP, men poche på 6 mm. Kan vi undgå at belaste +7 i alignerbehandlingen ? Pt håber han kam få lov at bevare den indtil videre.Er der større risiko for at han mister den hurtigere , hvis vi starter clear correct behandling op? Med venlig hilsen Benedicte Kloster'
Customer asked: 'Hej HelleTak for din mail og kommentarer. 😊Du må gerne hjælpe med setuppet.Vi ønsker at opnå hjørnetandsføring.Mvh Benedicte man. 5. maj 2025, 11.25 skrev Helle Hatt <tps@alignerservice.com>:Hej BenedicteTusind tak for din mail og spørgsmål.Der vil skulle laves forholdsvis meget IPR i UK venstre side, men vi vil god kunne ekstruderer det. Det har eng god prognose, men det kan være det tager et par forsøg, alt afhængig af knogle kvaliteten og compliance.Med hensyn til +7 så vil der hvis der er PA på tanden være forøget risiko for at den midstes hurtigere. alternativet er at udelade den fra behandling, og så lave et stop på tanden eller på skinnen i UK (muligvis kan posterior biteramps bruges, hvis den ikke er for høj, og kommer til at sidde korrekt mod +7.Dette er for at sikre at +7 ikke elongerer.Jeg håber det hjælper og giver mening.Sig endlig til hvis du har brig for hjælp med at rette setuppet til. Book releaseMastering Aligner Orthodontics: A Guide for General DentistsCan be ordered at:Mastering Aligner Orthodontics | AlignerService.comOr buy directly on Amazonhttps://a.co/d/4pXzb1SKind regards / Venlig hilsen / Mit freundlichen Grüßen Helle Hatt DDSHelle@alignerservice.comAlignerservice.com-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------DisclaimerAlignerService consists of dentists and orthodontists with extensive clear aligner experience giving clinical advice to practising dentists and their teams. Hej Rikke,
Tak for din besked – og ja, alt er vel her i Schweiz 
😊
Jeg udleverer som udgangspunkt ikke alle slides fra mine præsentationer, da de primært består af billeder og korte nøgleord, som understøtter det, jeg fortæller mundtligt.
Men hvis Lene har nogle specifikke spørgsmål eller emner, hun gerne vil dykke mere ned i, er hun meget velkommen til at skrive til mig – så sender jeg gerne de relevante slides eller materialer, der kan hjælpe hende videre.
Alternativt vil jeg varmt anbefale vores bog “Mastering Aligner Orthodontics”.
Den fungerer som en trin-for-trin-guide og kan bruges både til at gennemgå konkrete cases og som et opslagsværk, når man har brug for overblik over bestemte emner. Bogen indeholder også en række checklister og praktiske tips, som mange har haft glæde af efter
 kurset.
Angående podcast-optagelserne: Jeg regner med at kunne melde nogle datoer ud inden længe – jeg vender tilbage så snart jeg har det sidste på plads. (Venter aktuelt på svar fra Mette)

Agent replied: 'Lieber Sebastian Das Setup von #2078684 ist jetzt bereit für deine Genehmigung.Der untere Bogen hat einen IPR. Keine IPR im oberen Bogen.In der unteren Front wurden Lingual Crown Torque und Lingual Translation angewendet, um das Risiko einer Gingivarezession zu minimieren.In der oberen Front wurde Lingual Crown Torque geplant, um die Proklination der oberen Schneidezähne zu korrigieren.Bitte achte auf die Bewegung an 42 und die Rotation an 35. Bitte denk daran, den Patienten anzuweisen, die Aligner fest auf die Zähne zu kauen, einschließlich der Engager, und die Aligner mindestens 22 Stunden pro Tag zu tragen. Dies wird dazu beitragen, Probleme mit dem Tracking zu minimieren. Ich empfehle außerdem, dass der Patient dreimal täglich fünf Minuten lang mit dem hinteren Ende einer Zahnbürste auf den Alignern kaut, um das Eindringen zu erleichtern.Bitte lass mich wissen, wenn du irgendwelche Fragen hast. Ich wünsche Ihnen einen schönen Nachmittag.Book releaseMastering Aligner Orthodontics: A Guide for General DentistsCan be ordered at:Mastering Aligner Orthodontics | AlignerService.comOr buy directly on Amazonhttps://a.co/d/4pXzb1SKind regards / Venlig hilsen / Mit freundlichen Grüßen Helle Hatt DDSHelle@alignerservice.comAlignerservice.com-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------DisclaimerAlignerService consists of dentists and orthodontists with extensive clear aligner experience giving clinical advice to practising dentists and their teams. subject: N. Troublefield #27953654
content:
Customer asked: 'Hello. I would like this case to be reviewed by Priyanka and her and I have established rapport. I would like discuss this case in detail. I believe I am on the right track but I want to be sure before accepting the Clan Check. Thank you for your consideration. Login: mwallace23Password: Cambam14!Pt concerns: Unhappy with strained esthetics due to missing #10 and spacing. Pt would like to have gummy smile improved.Findings: - Congenitally missing #10- #11 is in #10 position, #12 is in #11- Gingival asymmetry and gummy smile- Class I molar occlusion right side- Class II molar occlusion left side- 4mm overjet- 5 mm overbite- Crowding #23-26- Diastema: #6,7,8,9,11,12- Acceptable midline and axial inclination - Collapsed buccal corridor My concerns:- possible compromise in smile esthetics- canine guidance- amount of teeth that need to be restored to reduce esthetic strainDesired outcome: Smile rehabilitation using resin or porcelain (will educate patient on both options)- Canine substitution - Collapsed spacing - Esthetic harmony with respect to existing biological limits- Gingival harmonySuper excited to work on this case with you. If I think of anymore information I’ll be sure to circle back. Marquita Wallace, DDS'
Agent replied: 'Dear  Marquita Wallace​Thank you for your mail.It is our pleasure to help you with your request.The AlignerService team will be ready to respond to your request as soon as possible within normal business hours.Kind regards / Venlig hilsen / Mit freundlichen Grüßen Helle Hatt DDStps@alignerservice.comAlignerservice.com'

Agent replied: 'Guten Morgen Frau KircherDas Setup für #2009591 ist nun zur Genehmigung bereit.Es gibt wenig ASR zwischen 12,21, um das schwarze Dreieck zu minimieren.Die Inklination im Oberkiefer wird verbessert, um das Risiko von Zahnverschleiß in der Zukunft zu minimieren. Dies hat zu einem vergrößerten Überbiss geführt. Der Überbiss kann durch mehr ASR im Oberkiefer jetzt oder in einer Revision minimiert werden, wenn Sie dies zu einem späteren Zeitpunkt für notwendig halten.Es gibt einige große Rotationen (vertikale Engager). Bitte stellen Sie sicher, dass die Aligner jederzeit korrekt auf den Engagern sitzen, um das Risiko von Tracking-Problemen zu minimieren.Ich habe eine Anleitung mit Tipps und Tricks für die Arbeit mit ClearCorrect beigefügt.Bitte denk daran, den Patienten anzuweisen, die Aligner fest auf die Zähne zu kauen, einschließlich der Engager, und die Aligner mindestens 22 Stunden pro Tag zu tragen. Dies wird dazu beitragen, Probleme mit dem Tracking zu minimieren. Ich empfehle außerdem, dass der Patient dreimal täglich fünf Minuten lang mit dem hinteren Ende einer Zahnbürste auf den Alignern kaut, um das Eindringen zu erleichtern.Bitte lassen Sie mich wissen, wenn Sie irgendwelche Fragen haben.​Ich wünsche Ihnen einen schönen Tag.Book releaseMastering Aligner Orthodontics: A Guide for General DentistsCan be ordered at:Mastering Aligner Orthodontics | AlignerService.comOr buy directly on Amazonhttps://a.co/d/4pXzb1SKind regards / Venlig hilsen / Mit freundlichen Grüßen Helle Hatt DDSHelle@alignerservice.comAlignerservice.com-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------DisclaimerAlignerService consists of dentists and orthodontists with extensive clear aligner experience giving clinical advice to practising dentists and their teams. Agent replied: 'Good morning PeterThe setup on #2101340 is now ready for your approval.There are a lot of IPR in the upper arch to minimise the overjet.I have added c-chain stages, the last two stages should only be used if the proximal contacts are too loose at the end of the treatment. They are meant to tighten the contact points. If the contact points are fine, you should not use the last two stages.There are a lot of big rotations there has a high risk of tracking issues.especially 44,45, I have also on those teeth added lingual engagers to help with the grip from the aligner to the teeth. I have left a little space around those teeth as well to minimise the amount that the lower teeth need to be retracted.When we close the space by lingual retraction, we minimise the space for the tongue. When the tongue has less space, there is a high risk of relapse as well as sleep apnea because then there is only one way for the tongue to go, and that is back.I hope it makes sense.Please remember to instruct the patient to chew the aligners firmly onto their teeth, including the engagers, and to wear them for at least 22 hours a day. This will help minimise any tracking issues. I also recommend that the patient chews on the aligners using the back end of a toothbrush or chewies three times a day for five minutes to assist with the intrusion.Please let me know if you have any questions.Book releaseMastering Aligner Orthodontics: A Guide for General DentistsCan be ordered at:Mastering Aligner Orthodontics | AlignerService.comOr buy directly on Amazonhttps://a.co/d/4pXzb1SKind regards / Venlig hilsen / Mit freundlichen Grüßen Helle Hatt DDSHelle@alignerservice.comAlignerservice.com-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------DisclaimerAlignerService consists of dentists and orthodontists with extensive clear aligner experience giving clinical advice to practising dentists and their teams. subject: Ny case # 2100393
content:
Customer asked: 'Kære Helle! Længe siden. Jeg har en ny case på en kollega Mohamad Chafiq case nr: # 2100393 hvad skal jeg skrive på Collaborator for at koble dig på? Det er længe siden.. Vil du se på setuppet, evt. rette og hjælpe med denne case? Tak! Mvh. Ahmad Qadri. Dentaklinikken Hillerød'
Customer asked: 'Modtaget, tak for den grundige forklaring 🙏🏽☺️Mvh Ahmad ons. 7. maj 2025 kl. 09.06 skrev Helle Hatt <helle@alignerservice.com>:Kære AhmadSå er setuppet på #2100393 klar til din godkendelse.Der er lidt IPR i UK for at holde midtlinjen.Der er tilføjet C-chain skinner, der er de sidste to skinner der kun skal bruges hvis de approximal kontakter i fronten er forløs efter sidste skinne er brugt. Så kan man tage en skinne og lade patienten bruge den i 1-2 uger og så tjekke kontakt punkterne igen. Hvis de stadig er lidt løse så går man videre til næste skinne. Er kontakterne der i mode fine, så skal man ikke bruge den næste skinne.Du skal holde øje med rotationerne på +1,2-1,3 og sikre at skinnerne kommer korrekt på engagerne hver gang for at minimerer risikoen for tracking issues.Husk at instruer patienten i at tygge skinnerne rigtigt godt ned over engagers og tænder, brug gerne bagenden af tandbørsten eller chewies, samt at bruge skinnerne 22 timer i døgnet, for at minimerer risikoen for tracking issues.​​For at hjælpe intrusioner på vej anbefaler jeg at tygge på skinnerne 3 gange om dagen i 5 min.Sig endelig til hvis du har nogle spørgsmål.Book releaseMastering Aligner Orthodontics: A Guide for General DentistsCan be ordered at:Mastering Aligner Orthodontics | AlignerService.comOr buy directly on Amazonhttps://a.co/d/4pXzb1SKind regards / Venlig hilsen / Mit freundlichen Grüßen Helle Hatt DDSHelle@alignerservice.comAlignerservice.com-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------DisclaimerAlignerService consists of dentists and orthodontists with extensive clear aligner experience giving clinical advice to practising dentists and their teams. Based on information achieved through the doctor portal of the doctor's preferred clear aligner system (Invisalign, ClearCorrect, SureSmile, Spark), AlignerService offers tentative orthodontic diagnostics, orthodontic treatment planning, optimization of digital treatment plans, and treatment support. AlignerService never has physical contact with the patients or the doctor. As a consequence, neither AlignerService nor its employees can take any responsibility for the treatment outcomes. Any clear aligner software represents planned tooth movements based on a digital setup and does not reflect actual tooth movements; tooth movement data should be used as a reference only. The doctor is solely responsible for prescribing and administering orthodontic treatment and maintaining all patient medical records. Treatment Planning Services received from AlignerService shall only be considered as recommendations and the ultimate decision on whether or not to apply the Treatment Planning Services or to adapt them to the conditions of the specific patient remains with the treating doctor. AlignerService shall not become liable for any damages, claims, liabilities, etc. that may result or arise in context with the Treatment Planning Services provided to the doctor.Clear aligner therapy is unpredictable. AlignerService does not guarantee a successful treatment outcome. Agent replied: 'Dear Nikolaus Fuchs​Thank you for your mail.It is our pleasure to help you with your request.The AlignerService team will be ready to respond to your request as soon as possible within normal business hours.Kind regards / Venlig hilsen / Mit freundlichen Grüßen Helle Hatt DDStps@alignerservice.comAlignerservice.com'
Agent replied: 'Liebe Flovielen Dank für Deine Mail.Das ist richtig. Es ist nicht realistisch, auf der linken Seite eine KL I zu erreichen.Auf der rechten Seite gibt es eine KL I Molarenrelation.Du musst verstehen, dass es nicht immer möglich ist, eine KL I bei erwachsenen Patienten zu erreichen. Der Patient hat sich im Laufe seines Lebens an die KL II-Okklusion gewöhnt und ist oft in dieser Okklusion stabil. Es besteht ein hohes Risiko, dass der Okklusion instabil wird und sich die Situation des Patienten im Vergleich zum Ausgangszustand verschlechtert.In diesem Fall ist ein chirurgischer Eingriff erforderlich, wenn man für diesen Patienten eine KL I-Molarenrelation erreichen will.Ich hoffe, das hilft dir.Book releaseMastering Aligner Orthodontics: A Guide for General DentistsCan be ordered at:Mastering Aligner Orthodontics | AlignerService.comOr buy directly on Amazonhttps://a.co/d/4pXzb1SKind regards / Venlig hilsen / Mit freundlichen Grüßen Helle Hatt DDSHelle@alignerservice.comAlignerservice.com-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------DisclaimerAlignerService consists of dentists and orthodontists with extensive clear aligner experience giving clinical advice to practising dentists and their teams. subject: ClearCorrect case #1118697
content:
Customer asked: 'Good afternoon dear dr Helle,




My first and only Clear Correct case #1118697  treatment is near end.

The patient will receive her last aligners n:o 48 in the beginning of July.

-What shall we do after that?

 -When we will get the retainers; the aligners for the retaining or shoud the last aligners n:o 48 be used as retainers?

-How much the retaining aligners shall be used; during the nightime or more?

-When the engagers can be removed?

-What is your opinion about retaining wires, to the lingual surfaces of dd33-43 and palatal surfaces dd 13-23? Can they prevent the auto-rotation of the mandible forward and up? Could it be reasonable put the retaining wires later after the rotating of mandible
 and and then stop using the retaining aligners, what do you think about shcedule, when could the fixed  wire retainers could be possible?




Lots of questions, thank you about your patience!




Yours, Pertti Honkela'
Agent replied: 'Dear Pertti Honkela​Thank you for your mail.It is our pleasure to help you with your request.The AlignerService team will be ready to respond to your request as soon as possible within normal business hours.Kind regards / Venlig hilsen / Mit freundlichen Grüßen Helle Hatt DDStps@alignerservice.comAlignerservice.com'
Agent replied: 'Dear PerttiThank you for your email and your questions.My retainer protocol is as follows:The aligner can be used as a retainer for a couple of months before changing to an aligner retainer. I recommend full-time wear of the retainer for the first 3-4 months after finishing the treatment. Then 3-4 months with 16-18 hours wear, and after that nighttime wear for the rest of the life. We know that the biology hasn't finished the bone remodelling before 6-8 months after the last tooth movement. That is why it is really important to have retainers as much as possible in the beginning to prevent relapses.  I recommend handing out two sets. One set that the patient is using and one that the patient tests once a month. If the test set starts to feel tighter then it is time to change to a new set.You can, in principle, remove the engagers when you are done with the last aligner (after two weeks). A bonded retainer only retains the front teeth. You also have a lot of posterior movements in the case, so I would not recommend only bonded retainers.Bonded retainers will not prevent the autorotation of the mandible.The mandible should autorotate when the occlusion is changing. If you have a few contact points, you could polish them, and that will increase the autorotation of the mandible.If you need posterior settling for a bitter occlusion, I recommend the bonded retainer in the lower and a Hawley retainer i the upper arch.A fixed retainer could be added straight away.I hope this helps.Book releaseMastering Aligner Orthodontics: A Guide for General DentistsCan be ordered at:Mastering Aligner Orthodontics | AlignerService.comOr buy directly on Amazonhttps://a.co/d/4pXzb1SKind regards / Venlig hilsen / Mit freundlichen Grüßen Helle Hatt DDSHelle@alignerservice.comAlignerservice.com-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------DisclaimerAlignerService consists of dentists and orthodontists with extensive clear aligner experience giving clinical advice to practising dentists and their teams. Based on information achieved through the doctor portal of the doctor's preferred clear aligner system (Invisalign, ClearCorrect, SureSmile, Spark), AlignerService offers tentative orthodontic diagnostics, orthodontic treatment planning, optimization of digital treatment plans, and treatment support. AlignerService never has physical contact with the patients or the doctor. As a consequence, neither AlignerService nor its employees can take any responsibility for the treatment outcomes. Any clear aligner software represents planned tooth movements based on a digital setup and does not reflect actual tooth movements; tooth movement data should be used as a reference only. The doctor is solely responsible for prescribing and administering orthodontic treatment and maintaining all patient medical records. Treatment Planning Services received from AlignerService shall only be considered as recommendations and the ultimate decision on whether or not to apply the Treatment Planning Services or to adapt them to the conditions of the specific patient remains with the treating doctor. AlignerService shall not become liable for any damages, claims, liabilities, etc. that may result or arise in context with the Treatment Planning Services provided to the doctor.Clear aligner therapy is unpredictable. AlignerService does not guarantee a successful treatment outcome. Individual results will vary.---- on Tue, 06 May 2025 16:51:16 +0200  "Pertti honkela"<pertti.honkela@hotmail.com>  wrote ---- 



Good afternoon dear dr Helle,




My first and only Clear Correct case #1118697  treatment is near end.

The patient will receive her last aligners n:o 48 in the beginning of July.

-What shall we do after that?

 -When we will get the retainers; the aligners for the retaining or shoud the last aligners n:o 48 be used as retainers?

-How much the retaining aligners shall be used; during the nightime or more?

-When the engagers can be removed?

-What is your opinion about retaining wires, to the lingual surfaces of dd33-43 and palatal surfaces dd 13-23? Can they prevent the auto-rotation of the mandible forward and up? Could it be reasonable put the retaining wires later after the rotating of mandible
 and and then stop using the retaining aligners, what do you think about shcedule, when could the fixed  wire retainers could be possible?




Lots of questions, thank you about your patience!




Yours, Pertti Honkela'

subject: Re:[## 1571683 ##] Workflow including custom function.
content:
Customer asked: 'Hello Helle,Thank you for contacting Zoho Desk Support.We understand that you'd like to automatically update the due date field of an existing ticket whenever a new ticket comes in with the same ticket number(of the existing ticket) in the subject line, and then delete the newer ticket regardless of whether the due date update was successful. Since this requires significant changes, we'll raise a custom function request on our end to have the code written for you.However, we’d like to confirm how the due date should be set for the existing tickets should we always assign a static value of 12:00 PM to the due date field?Sincerely,Merlin John | Zoho DeskHow happy are you with our service?Loved it. Thanks! T ...OkayIt was bad. Sorry!  ...Support contact email has been changed to support@eu.zohodesk.com, please send us your future queries to our new email address.           Blogs · Forums · Help---- on Tue, 06 May 2025 17:24:42 +0530  "Helle Hatt"<helle@alignerservice.com>  wrote ---- Dear support.I have a workflow created where I would like to have s specific function executed.1. I recieve a new ticket from support@clearcorrect.com with a random number in the subject linge.2. The random munber should be used to search for a ticket in the “in progress” queue.3. if the ticket is found the due date should be updated to today at 12.00 pm (noon)4 if the ticket does not exist the new ticket can de deleted.5. when the exsisting ticket has been updated the new ticket can be deleded. this is my function script.// 1. Extract number from subjectsubject_text = input.subject;org_Id = 20082363592;for each  num in subject_text.toList(" "){ clean_word = num.replaceAll("[^0-9]",""); if(clean_word.isNumber() && clean_word.length() >= 4 && clean_word.length() <= 10) { subject_number = clean_word; info subject_number; }}ticket_number = subject_number;if(ticket_number != null || ticket_number != ""){ // 2. Search for tickets where subject contains the number and status is Open or In Progress; criteria = "(subject:contains:" + ticket_number + ")"; matching_tickets = zoho.desk.searchRecords(org_Id,"Tickets",{"searchStr":criteria}); info "going to check matching ticket data"; if(matching_tickets.get("data") != null && matching_tickets.get("data").size() > 0) { info "matching ticket has data"; ticket = matching_tickets.get("data").get(0); // 3. Set due date to today at 12:00 PM (UTC) today = zoho.currentdate.toString("yyyy-MM-dd"); due_date = today + "T12:00:00Z"; // 4. Update the ticket update_map = Map(); update_map.put("dueDate",due_date); } else { info "No matching tickets found."; }}else{ info "No valid ticket number found in subject.";}I get the logNo matter if a ticket has been found or not.I can also see in the log that there is not being created logs for all the incomming tickets this function should be used for.What am I/my developer doing wrong?Thank you.
Kind regards / Venlig hilsen / Mit freundlichen Grüßen Helle Hatt DDSHelle@alignerservice.comAlignerservice.com'

subject: Case 2102062
content:
Customer asked: 'Dear Miss Hatt,

Please make a set-up of Jade sommen (2102062). 
I am aware of your prices. Please send billing to benedenti beerse. 
Main complaint: crowding lower jaw, she also has a feeling that a little diastema is forming between 21 and 11. 

Kind regards,
Pommelien'
Agent replied: 'Dear Pomelien,The setup for case #2102062 is now ready for your approval.IPR has been added in the lower arch to gain overjet. IPR mainly planned on the lower left side to improve midline alignment as well.Please remember to instruct the patient to chew the aligners firmly onto their teeth, including over the engagers, and to wear the aligners for at least 22 hours per day. This will help minimize any tracking issues.At each recall appointment, please check the inter-proximal contacts of the teeth planned for movement using dental floss to ensure that there is sufficient space and that the movements are tracking properly. If the teeth are experiencing friction from adjacent teeth, tracking may be compromised. If the inter-proximal contacts are too tight, please use a polishing IPR strip (yellow in the color-coded IPR system, with a thickness of 0.08 mm) to relieve the contact points.Please let me know if you have any questions.Our new mail address for collaborator search is: helle@alignerservice.comCollaborator name is AlignerService Global TPS  Kind regards,Priyanka Cherian tps@alignerservice.comAlignerservice.comDisclaimer:AlignerService consists of dentists and orthodontists with extensive clear aligner experience, providing clinical advice to practicing dentists and their teams. Takk for hjelp med setup.


Hva betyr forkortelsen HOB her?


Mvh Jan Oliver



Sendt fra Outlook for iOS

From: Helle Hatt <tps@alignerservice.com>
Sent: Thursday, May 8, 2025 4:45:54 PM
To: Jan Oliver Rolstad <jan_oliver_rolstad@hotmail.com>
Subject: Re: Clear Correct Case # 2079759
 




Kære Jan



Så er setuppet på #2079759 klar til din godkendelse.



Der er IPR i UK for at minimerer risikoen for retraktioner. I OK for at minimerer HOB.



Der er en del store rotationer derfor ses så magne vertikal engagers.
Patienten har gummy smile, men vi har ikke fokuseret på at margo gingiva bliver aligner, men kere inc. kanterne.

Hvis du ønsker det anderledes så sig endelig til. Du kan også lave lidt gingiva konturering efter behandlingen på 13,12,11 hvis du finder det nødvendigt.







Husk
 at instruer patienten i at tygge skinnerne rigtigt godt ned over engagers og tænder, brug gerne bagenden af tandbørsten eller chewies, samt at bruge skinnerne 22 timer i døgnet, for at minimerer risikoen for tracking issues.​​


For at hjælpe intrusioner på vej anbefaler jeg at tygge på skinnerne 3 gange om dagen i 5 min.






Sig
 endelig til hvis du har nogle spørgsmål.

From: Helle Hatt <tps@alignerservice.com>

To: Jan Oliver Rolstad <jan_oliver_rolstad@hotmail.com>
Subject: Re: Clear Correct Case # 2079759
 




Kære Jan



Så er setuppet på #2079759 klar til din godkendelse.



Der er IPR i UK for at minimerer risikoen for retraktioner. I OK for at minimerer HOB.



Der er en del store rotationer derfor ses så magne vertikal engagers.
Patienten har gummy smile, men vi har ikke fokuseret på at margo gingiva bliver aligner, men kere inc. kanterne.

Hvis du ønsker det anderledes så sig endelig til. Du kan også lave lidt gingiva konturering efter behandlingen på 13,12,11 hvis du finder det nødvendigt.







Husk
 at instruer patienten i at tygge skinnerne rigtigt godt ned over engagers og tænder, brug gerne bagenden af tandbørsten eller chewies, samt at bruge skinnerne 22 timer i døgnet, for at minimerer risikoen for tracking issues.​​


For at hjælpe intrusioner på vej anbefaler jeg at tygge på skinnerne 3 gange om dagen i 5 min.






Sig
 endelig til hvis du har nogle spørgsmål.

subject: Sagsnr. 2099907 + Sagsnr. 2099905
content:
Customer asked: 'Hej Helle

Jeg har en Bror og søster her som ønsker at få rettet tænderne. De har været meget glade for 1 settup. Hvor lang tid tænker du med behandlingen. Hos søsteren tænker jeg der er brug for midlinekorrektion UK ? 





Med venlig hilsen

Uzma Riaz
Tandplejer og ClearCorrect ansvarlig
Godt Smil Tandlægerne

Telefon: +45 44 22 41 32
E-mail: uzma.riaz@godtsmil.dk'
Customer asked: 'Hej Helle 

Du må gerne lave setup klar på dem begge tak 🙂 





Med venlig hilsen

Uzma Riaz
Tandplejer og ClearCorrect ansvarlig
Godt Smil Tandlægerne

Telefon: +45 44 22 41 32
E-mail: uzma.riaz@godtsmil.dk








Fra: Helle Hatt <helle@alignerservice.com>
Sendt: 7. maj 2025 00:06
Til: Uzma Riaz <Uzma.Riaz@godtsmil.dk>
Emne: Re: Sagsnr. 2099907 + Sagsnr. 2099905
 




 


Warning: This email originated from outside of Godt Smil’s trusted e-mail environment. Do not click any links or open attachments unless you recognize
 the sender and have confidence the content is safe.

 











Kære Uzma



Tak for din mail.



Case #2099905

er en moderat case, men uden at flytte molare og kun lidt på præmolar hvis nødvendigt.

IPR i OK højre side for at rette midtlinjen.



Behandlingstid ca 1 år pga. rotationer og rod bevægelser i front.





Case #2099907

Lidt det samme, men tænker ikke at have IPR i OK.

Der er også nogle store rotationer der kan drille lidt.



Behandlingstid ca. 1 år.

Any
 clear aligner software represents planned tooth movements based on a digital setup and does not reflect actual tooth movements; tooth movement data should be used as a reference only. The doctor is solely responsible for prescribing and administering orthodontic
 treatment and maintaining all patient medical records. 




Treatment
 Planning Services received from AlignerService shall only be considered as recommendations and the ultimate decision on whether or not to apply the Treatment Planning Services or to adapt them to the conditions of the specific patient remains with the treating
 doctor. 




AlignerService

Clear
 aligner therapy is unpredictable. AlignerService does not guarantee a successful treatment outcome. Individual results will vary.

Customer asked: '﻿Kære Helle Jeg vil gerne høre om det også er muligt at få sendt Ortojournalen på denne patient og på en tidligere case, som du også hjalp mig med.Det drejer sig om: Helene Ruusunen  Case nr 2068990Cecilie Eriksen        Case nr 2075513Tak på forhånd.Med venlig hilsen Yasmin Fariq     Den 29. apr. 2025 kl. 13.20 skrev Yasmin Fariq <yaf@dentalklinikken.dk>:﻿Kære Helle Tak for hjælpen og for en rigtig god forklaring. Jeg har godkendt setuppet. God dag. Mvh Yasmin Fariq Den 25. apr. 2025 kl. 15.02 skrev Helle Hatt <tps@alignerservice.com>:﻿Kære YasminSå er setuppet på #2075513 klar til din godkendelse.Der er IPR i OK for at sikre at HOB ikke bliver for stort efter regulering. Lidt mere i højre side for at bevare midtlinjen.Der er tilføjet C-chain skinner, der er de sidste to skinner der kun skal bruges hvis de approximal kontakter i fronten er forløs efter sidste skinne er brugt. Så kan man tage en skinne og lade patienten bruge den i 1-2 uger og så tjekke kontakt punkterne igen. Hvis de stadig er lidt løse så går man videre til næste skinne. Er kontakterne der i mode fine, så skal man ikke bruge den næste skinne.Der er store rotationer især på +1,2 som du skal holde øje med. Sikre dig at skinnerne kommer korrekt på engagerne for at mindske risikoen for tracking issues.Husk at instruer patienten i at tygge skinnerne rigtigt godt ned over engagers og tænder, brug gerne bagenden af tandbørsten eller chewies, samt at bruge skinnerne 22 timer i døgnet, for at minimerer risikoen for tracking issues.​​Sig endelig til hvis du har nogle spørgsmål.Book releaseMastering Aligner Orthodontics: A Guide for General DentistsCan be ordered at:Mastering Aligner Orthodontics | AlignerService.comOr buy directly on Amazonhttps://a.co/d/4pXzb1SKind regards / Venlig hilsen / Mit freundlichen Grüßen Helle Hatt DDSHelle@alignerservice.comAlignerservice.com-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------DisclaimerAlignerService consists of dentists and orthodontists with extensive clear aligner experience giving clinical advice to practising dentists and their teams. content:
Customer asked: 'Greetings from Guatemala City.
My name is Alejandro Rehwoldt, and I represent a dental facility equipped with our own in-house digital dental laboratory. We are currently expanding our services in the area of invisible orthodontics and are looking for a reliable partner to support us with case planning and design.
I am reaching out to inquire about the possibility of contracting your services specifically for the digital planning and design of clear aligner cases. Our goal is to handle the printing and manufacturing of the aligners locally in our laboratory, while relying on your expertise for the accurate setup and treatment planning of each case.
Could you please provide more information regarding your workflow, pricing, turnaround times, and any requirements on your end for collaboration?
We are excited about the potential of working together and look forward to hearing from you soon.
Warm regards,
Alejandro Rehwoldt 
Ceprosi Dental, Procad Lab

subject: Clear correct #2056417
content:
Customer asked: 'Guten Morgen Frau Dr. Helle Hatt.
Bitte planen Sie meinen Fall ; Florian Lederer 2056417 . Er hat im ersten Quadraten einen Kreuzbiss . Bitte um Verbesserung der Klasse und Front Korrektur . 

Mit freundlichen Grüßen 

Dr Koren Raphaela 
Rotkreuzgasse 3 ,
 9620 Hermagor 



Von meinem iPhone gesendet'
Customer asked: 'Vielen lieben Dank. 
Ich finde ihren Ansatz sehr gut . Bitte Bescheid geben wenn die Planung fertig ist .


Mit freundlichen Grüßen 
Dr Koren 




Von meinem iPhone gesendet

Am 07.05.2025 um 11:12 schrieb Helle Hatt <helle@alignerservice.com>:




﻿


Sehr geehrte Frau Raphaela


vielen Dank für Ihre Mail.


Es ist kein einfacher Fall.
Ich sehe zunächst, dass die Molarenrelation in Ordnung ist und eine stabile Okklusion vorliegt. Das heißt, ich würde an den Molaren so wenig wie möglich bewegen.
Allerdings gibt es eine Tendenz zu einer KL III mit Abständen im Oberkiefer.
Ich halte es nicht für realistisch, alle Lücken zu schließen. Das würde zu viel ASR im Unterkiefer erfordern und die Front zu sehr zurückziehen, was ihm ein konkaves Profil geben würde.


Ich würde empfehlen, die Lücken um die Seitenzähne und/oder distal der Eckzähne zu belassen und einige restaurative Arbeiten/Kompositaufbauten vorzunehmen.


Ich hoffe, dass dieser Ansatz für Sie in Ordnung ist.


Ich werde Ihnen Bescheid geben, wenn das Setup zu Ihrer Genehmigung fertig ist.


Book release






















Mastering Aligner Orthodontics: A Guide for General Dentists



Can be ordered at:

Mastering Aligner
 Orthodontics | AlignerService.com
Or buy directly on Amazon

https://a.co/d/4pXzb1S







Kind regards / Venlig hilsen / Mit freundlichen Grüßen 
Helle Hatt DDS


Helle@alignerservice.com
Alignerservice.com

subject: Vurdering af case og rehab. J4O5
content:
Customer asked: 'Kære Helle 




Hvordan vil du vurdere denne case? 




Patienten ønsker lukning af diastema, da mellemrum er blevet forværret efter fjernelse af 6+. Pt ønsker implantat regio 6+ efter behandling, men spørg til om det er muligt at bygge 2+,+2 op efter behandling. Hvordan tænker du at den bedste tilgang er til dette? 








Dall



Jeff



J4O5



Hans Straarup Rasmussen





Review
 setup & staged models 




2025-05-05






2025-05-22



Active













Med venlig hilsen


     Hans Straarup RasmussenTandlægeColosseum Tandlægerne | BrøndbyNygårds Plads 3 B, 2605 BrøndbyTelefon: +45 3675 0133 Hans.Rasmussen@colosseumklinikken.dk Vi passer godt på dine data – læs mere.Vores emails er altid krypterede  – læs mere.'
Customer asked: 'Kære Helle




Nu har jeg snakket med Jeff, og han er klar på at komme i gang med behandling, vil du rette casen til, OBS at +1 er rodbehandlet med krone. Så tænker begrænset rykning af denne.  Patienten og jeg har snakket om at rykke det til en kombination af opbygning 3+,+3
 og 2+, +2. evt med plast mesialt for de nævnte tænder? 




Forstørret HOB vil være at fortrække. 








Dall



Jeff



J4O5



Hans Straarup Rasmussen





Review

2025-05-05






2025-05-22



Active











Med venlig hilsen


     Hans Straarup RasmussenTandlægeColosseum Tandlægerne | BrøndbyNygårds Plads 3 B, 2605 BrøndbyTelefon: +45 3675 0133 Hans.Rasmussen@colosseumklinikken.dk Vi passer godt på dine data – læs mere.Vores emails er altid krypterede  – læs mere.





Fra: Helle Hatt <helle@alignerservice.com>
Sendt: 7. maj 2025 16:17
Til: Hans Straarup Rasmussen <Hans.Rasmussen@colosseumklinikken.dk>
Emne: Re: Vurdering af case og rehab.
 



Kære Hans



Tak for din mail.



Det er en moderat case.



Jeg vill bygge 2+2 eller 3+3 op, eller en kombination. Det er ikke fordi jeg syntes at 2+2 er så lille i fohold til de andre tænder, så det kan være det bliver pænest med at 3+3 også bliver bygget op.



Jeg vill dog tilføje IPR i UK for at get et lidt større HOB så især +1 ikke belastes for meget.



Behandlingstid 6-8 måneder.

 og 2+, +2. evt med plast mesialt for de nævnte tænder?

Emne: Re: Vurdering af case og rehab.
 



Kære Hans



Tak for din mail.



Det er en moderat case.



Jeg vill bygge 2+2 eller 3+3 op, eller en kombination. Det er ikke fordi jeg syntes at 2+2 er så lille i fohold til de andre tænder, så det kan være det bliver pænest med at 3+3 også bliver bygget op.



Jeg vill dog tilføje IPR i UK for at get et lidt større HOB så især +1 ikke belastes for meget.



Behandlingstid 6-8 måneder.

subject: Vedr Case # 2097998, Case # 2086956, Case # 2079647
content:
Customer asked: 'Kære Helle
 
Følgende cases ønskes en vurdering om sværhedsgrad. 
 
Case # 2097998: Her ønskes sådan set primært rettelse af trangstilling, hvor sandsynligt er det at udnytte melemrummene distalt i tandrækken til formålet?
 
Case # 2086956: denne patient ønsker optimering af antal kontakter mellemtænderne og derudover sekundært at lukke mellemrummene og få et mere æstetisk smil
 
Case # 2079647: primær bekymring trangstilling
 
 
Med venlig hilsen

Tandklinikkenn v. Stine Elkjær
Åboulevard 7 2.th
1635 Kbh V
Tlf. 35357568
www.tandklinikelkjaer.dk'
Customer asked: '”Case # 2097998: Her ønskes sådan set primært rettelse af trangstilling, hvor sandsynligt er det at udnytte mellemrummene distalt i tandrækken til formålet?
 
Moderat sværhedsgrad
Mellemrummene kan godt udnyttes, men ikke lukkes, Det vil kræve for meget IPR i UK.
Behandlingstid ca 1 år.”
 
Vedr. ovenstående, vurderer du at udfordringen med denne case er trangstillingen i uk eller distalisering og udvidelse af tandbue i ok? Hvorfor bliver en case moderat af at der
 udføres IPR? Er det den ortodontiske bevægelse eller udførelsen af behandling der bliver uforudsigelig?
Hvis nu pt. accepterer behandling og indstiller sig på mange IPR vil det der så være noget ekstraordinær man skal informere pt, fx en større usikkerhed og ændringer undervejs?
Undskyld de mange spørgsmål, synes heller ikke jeg kan finde noget om det i jeres bog. Det er et mønster jeg har bemærket at cases oftest vurderes moderate pga IPR. Tak på forhånd
 
 

 
Med venlig hilsen
Tandlæge Reda Alturfi/
 
Tandklinikkenn v. Stine Elkjær
Åboulevard 7 2.th
1635 Kbh V
Tlf. 35357568
www.tandklinikelkjaer.dk

 


Fra: Helle Hatt <helle@alignerservice.com>

Sendt: 7. maj 2025 14:23
Til: Reda Alturfi <Reda@tandklinikelkjaer.dk>
Emne: Re: Vedr Case # 2097998, Case # 2086956, Case # 2079647


 



Kære Reda


 


Tak for din mail.


 


 


Case # 2097998: Her ønskes sådan set primært rettelse af trangstilling, hvor sandsynligt er det at udnytte melemrummene distalt i tandrækken til formålet?


 


Moderat sværhedsgrad


Mellemrummene kan godt udnyttes, men ikke lukkes, Det vil kræve for meget IPR i UK.


Behandlingstid ca 1 år.


 


 


Case # 2086956: denne patient ønsker optimering af antal kontakter mellemtænderne og derudover sekundært at lukke mellemrummene og få et mere æstetisk smil


 


Det er en moderat case. Jeg ser ingen mellemrum, men tenderende til svær trangstilling.


Det vil kræve en del IPR for at få plads til at roterer tænderne i OK.


Der er risiko for tracking issues på lateralerne.


Behandlingstid 1-1,5 år.


 


 


Case # 2079647: primær bekymring trangstilling


Måske har du bytte rund på forklaring og case nummer.


Det kan godt være lidt af en scær case, da biddet ikke ser stabilt ud, og det er det ønsket går på.


Jeg vil først finde CR, find hvor patienten har neutral kæbeposition, og så se hvad og hvordan.


Unge funktionen skal også undersøget, da det er mellemrum båd OK og UK, tyder det på en stor tunge, mend lidt uvane.


 


Behandlingstid ca 1 år.

Can be ordered at:

Or buy directly on Amazon

Kind regards / Venlig hilsen / Mit freundlichen Grüßen 
Helle Hatt DDS


 


Helle@alignerservice.com


Alignerservice.com
